programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: A 1990 edition of Arena made to celebrate the centenary of the mystery writers birth, looking at the life and work of the woman who created Miss Marple, Hercule Poirot and The Mousetrap. The programme looks at how an adolescent Christie read crime reports from newspapers and discussed the ways in which people had died, and also examies the authors mysterious disappearance in 1926

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.sub-title: The Mirror Crackd from Side to Side
programme.desc: A film star arrives from America and throws a summer garden party for the entire village of St Mary Mead - where one of her fans drinks a poisoned cocktail and promptly drops dead. Fortunately, the guest list includes Miss Marple, who immediately sets about tracking down the killer. Feature-length drama, starring Joan Hickson, Claire Bloom and Barry Newman

programme.title: Parkinson
programme.desc: An interview with the actor and raconteur from 1975 in which he regales Michael Parkinson with stories of his early days in Hollywood, from his first-ever movie lines to some hilariously disastrous film publicity stunts

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom learns Margo has been keeping appointments at a mysterious address and immediately leaps to the conclusion that she is having an affair - but doesnt know how to break the news to Jerry. Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Penelope Keith

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Hacker courageously puts his ministerial career in the balance by deciding to inform the prime minister of British arms sales to Italian terrorists. Sir Humphrey launches a frantic damage-limitation exercise to ensure vested interests arent compromised. Political comedy, with Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Arena

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.sub-title: The Mirror Crackd from Side to Side

Fortunately, the guest list includes Miss Marple, who immediately sets about tracking down the killer. Feature-length drama, starring Joan Hickson, Claire Bloom and Barry Newman

programme.title: Wildlife on One
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the phenomenal construction abilities of the beaver, which combines the skills of a lumberjack, carpenter and hydro-engineer. He compares the industrious creature to humans to find out who deserves the title of master builder

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don heads to India, where he takes in some of the most masterful examples of horticultural and architectural extravagance in the world - including the gardens of the Taj Mahal. Along the way, the green-fingered presenter investigates the majestic tomb gardens of the Mughal emperors, and a unique rock sculpture garden created from discarded objects and rubbish

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: Katie Derham presents from the Royal Albert Hall as Riccardo Minasi conducts the Hamburg-based Ensemble Resonanz and soloists Clara-Jumi Kang and Timothy Ridout in an all-Mozart celebration, including music from The Marriage of Figaro and Don Giovanni

programme.title: Life of a Mountain: A Year on Helvellyn
programme.desc: Documentary observing 12 months on the mountain in the Lake District, featuring insights from those that live by, care for and visit the area. The films contributors create a picture of Helvellyn that combines nature, adventure sports, art, survival and history. Featuring an RAF low-level fighter plane flight through the much-loved landscape

programme.title: Britains Lost Waterlands: Escape to Swallows and Amazons Country
programme.desc: Presenters Dick Strawbridge and Professor Alice Roberts explore the British landscapes that inspired childrens author Arthur Ransome to write his famous series Swallows and Amazons. Strawbridge uses vintage boats to investigate three iconic waterlands - the Lake District, the Norfolk broads, and the Suffolk coastline - while Roberts takes a look at the shore lines

programme.title: Genius of the Ancient World
programme.desc: Bettany Hughes turns her attention to Socrates, detailing how the Athenian philosopher secured a reputation as an influential maverick. She also highlights how his contributions as one of the founders of Western philosophy did not please his detractors, as his outspoken defence of his beliefs ultimately led to his execution

programme.title: The Story of Welsh Art
programme.desc: Huw Stephens explores how, from the 18th-century, the dramatic landscape of Wales captivated artists like Richard Wilson and JMW Turner, who painted it in ways that changed the course of art history. Huw also discovers the work of Penry Williams, a Merthyr Tydfil artist who was commissioned to paint his home towns vast Cyfarthfa ironworks

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens

Along the way, the green-fingered presenter investigates the majestic tomb gardens of the Mughal emperors, and a unique rock sculpture garden created from discarded objects and rubbish

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Henrique Sá Pessoa and Poppy OToole and special guests Brie Larson and Courtney McBroom. Drinks expert Olly Smith chooses the wine to accompany the studio dishes while Sam Heughan mixes some cocktails

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick visits Europes largest tea plantation, on the banks of the River Fal, bakes a simple yet sumptuous fruited tea loaf and travels to Penzance, where he enjoys an invigorating dip in the UKs largest outdoor seawater lido. He also finds out how Cornwall inspired Charles Dickens and how the county found its way into A Christmas Carol

programme.title: Football Focus

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Jeanette Kwakye presents coverage of the second session on day eight of the biennial event, held this year at Japan National Stadium in Tokyo. The heptathlon concludes with the 800m at 1.11, with Great Britains Katarina Johnson-Thompson hoping to retain the title. The decathlon has one more event today with the 400m from 1.55, and the action concludes with the mens 800m final at 2.22. Finals also take place in the womens javelin from 1.05 and 5,000m at 1.29. With analysis from Jessica Ennis-Hill and commentary by Steve Cram, Steve Backley, Andrew Cotter, Colin Jackson, Paula Radcliffe and Stef Reid

programme.title: Live Womens Rugby World Cup 2025
programme.desc: England v France (Kick-off 3.30pm). Coverage of the second semi-final, which comes from Ashton Gate in Bristol. The hosts have been in fine form so far, topping their pool and comfortably defeating Scotland 40-8 in the quarter-finals. The French also topped their group, before coming back from 13-0 down at half time against Ireland in the last eight to win 18-13

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman welcome 15 new famous faces, reality stars and content creators to the Strictly ballroom to pair them with their professional partners, while judges Shirley Ballas, Craig Revel Horwood, Motsi Mabuse and Anton Du Beke give their initial thoughts on the couples. Theres also a routine from the reigning champions Chris McCausland and Dianne Buswell and music by Jessie J. The contestants are Alex Kingston, Balvinder Sopal, Dani Dyer, Stefan Dennis, Lewis Cope, Vicky Pattison, Harry Aikines-Aryeetey, Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink, Karen Carney, Chris Robshaw, Ellie Goldstein, Ross King, La Voix, Thomas Skinner and George Clarke

programme.title: Michael McIntyres 25th Year Stand-Up Special
programme.desc: Michael McIntyre celebrates 25 years of stand-up comedy with Macnificent, his latest sold-out show. This performance, recorded at the London Palladium, is filled with the funnymans observations of everyday life, and promises to be a night to remember as he marks a special milestone

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Iain finds himself on his most frightening HART mission yet and is forced to confront his problems when he endangers the life of a team member. Nicole decides she wants a future with Ngozi but shocking events stop her from telling her

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Liverpool v Everton at Anfield and Manchester United v Chelsea at Old Trafford. Reigning champions Liverpool will have been expecting three points and bragging rights against their Merseyside neighbours. The Blues and Red Devils were both looking to claim victory after they had to share the spoils in a 1-1 draw at the Theatre of Dreams last term. Plus, Brighton and Hove Albion v Tottenham Hotspur, Burnley v Nottingham Forest, West Ham United v Crystal Palace, Wolverhampton Wanderers v Leeds United and Fulham v Brentford

programme.title: Before I Go to Sleep
programme.desc: A woman who cannot retain her memories following a traumatic accident is contacted by a mysterious neuropsychologist, who offers to help her recover the truth about her condition. As she tries to piece together the events of her past, she begins to fear neither her husband nor the doctor are who they seem to be. Thriller, starring Nicole Kidman, Colin Firth and Mark Strong

programme.desc: The Rev Mark Russell leads a service at Islandmagee Presbyterian Church in Co Antrim on the theme of unity, with readings from Corinthians and music by the gathered congregations from Islandmagee, Ballycarry and Whitehead. With a sermon by the churchs Rev Peter Bovill, and prayers led by Claire Sego of Whitehead Presbyterian Church

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Jeanette Kwakye presents coverage of the second session on the ninth and final day of the biennial event, held this year at Japan National Stadium in Tokyo. Relay events form a key part of the final days schedules, with the mens and womens 4x400m races taking place at 12.25 and 12.40 respectively, the womens 4x100m at 1.10 and the mens equivalent at 1.20. There should also be British interest in the womens 800m final at 11.35, with Olympic champion Keely Hodgkinson expected to be involved. Plus, finals in the womens high jump from 11.30, mens 5,000m at 11.50, discus from 12.00 and 1500m at 12.55, and the concluding event of the decathlon, the 1500m, at 12.55. With analysis from Jessica Ennis-Hill and Jenny Meadows, and commentary by Steve Cram, Steve Backley, Andrew Cotter, Colin Jackson, Paula Radcliffe and Stef Reid

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Claire McCollum helps bring in the harvest on a farm in Devon, where faith and farming go back five generations, and introduces favourite harvest hymns. Plus, a Christian residential community in Rutland for people with learning disabilities where growing and harvesting their own produce helps them flourish. Hymns include We Plough the Fields and Scatter, To God be the Glory and For the Beauty of the Earth

programme.title: Match of the Day Live

These teams finished third and second respectively last season and their squads contain several of the stars of Englands Euro 2025 triumph, including United midfielder Ella Toone and Arsenals attacking trio of Alessia Russo, Beth Mead and Chloe Kelly

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A couple and their three children are looking for a change of lifestyle for the whole family, and Nicki Chapman is in Norfolk to help them find it. programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Adam Henson explore the Solway Coast, where ancient traditions and fragile wildlife are being carefully nurtured by those who call the borderland home. Joe joins some of the last remaining Haaf netters in the tidal waters of the Solway Firth and Adam puts his sheepdog Gwen to work on his farm in the Cotswolds ahead of the biggest event in the trialling calendar

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow

Claire Tole-Moir leafs through a guest book from the Live Aid after party and Fuchsia Voremberg examines an illustrated Ships Log

programme.title: Freddie Flintoffs Field of Dreams
programme.sub-title: Freddie Flintoffs Field of Dreams: Ultimate Test
programme.desc: When numbers dwindle in Manchester, Presley and the boys are forced to go on a recruitment drive in order to save their team, but Freddie faces a losing battle fundraising the money to restore the club to its former glory. In Blackpool, after the team building day, the girls team play their first match against a prestigious boarding school. Plus, Bournemouth v Newcastle United and Sunderland v Aston Villa

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Comedy, written by and starring Mawaan Rizwan, following one mans quest for attention from anyone wholl give it to him. After splitting up with Guy, Jamma is now between jobs and sleeping on Winnies sofa. However, when he unexpectedly sees Guy for the first time in six months at Isaacs pop-up art exhibition, the spark between the exes is undeniable. To Jamma and Guys surprise a handsome stranger takes a special interest in their relationship status. With Russell Tovey

programme.desc: Guys double-booked himself, so asks Jamma to house-sit and let a builder in. Jamma finds Guys manuscript about exes, but on discovering hes not included is sent into a spiral. programme.sub-title: I Looked Like Phil Mitchell Til I Was About Three
programme.desc: Shane starts preparing for life as an uncle as Jades baby bump grows and Carmen gets disappointing news about her piercing plans. The Bilton Boys save the day for Robbies mum and Sammyjos plans for a new tattoo take a surprising turn

programme.title: BBC Comedy Short Films
programme.desc: Kenza is a donkey - or at least that is what her family thinks of her. When her uncle fires her from the family cafe, she formulates a plan to show them what shes truly capable of. Short comedy, starring Fatiha El-Ghorri

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Louise finally agrees to sleep with her eager boyfriend. Janet tries to be sexy for Jonny, and Gaz sends Donna out for a night on the town so he can entertain himself. Comedy, starring Ralf Little and Sheridan Smith

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Louise runs riot with her new-found social conscience, and Gaz advises Munch on how to handle women. Meanwhile, Jonny shows Donna a way of getting everything she has ever wanted - without paying. Comedy, starring Ralf Little and Will Mellor

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: David finds a new way to test Louises commitment, while Jonny fails to notice Janet is having second thoughts about getting married, and Gaz experiences a health scare. Sitcom, starring Ralf Little and Will Mellor

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Janet tries to dump Jonny, but suffers the indignity of being upstaged by some pasties. Louise gets revenge on David, and Donna plucks up the courage to pursue a new dream. Sitcom, starring Ralf Little, Will Mellor, Natalie Casey, Kathryn Drysdale and Sheridan Smith

programme.title: Athletics: World Championships Highlights
programme.desc: Sarah Mulkerrins presents action from the ninth and final day of the biennial event, held this year at Japan National Stadium in Tokyo. Great Britains Olympic champion Keely Hodgkinson hoped to be in contention in the 800m final, and her compatriot Josh Kerr was the reigning title-holder in the mens 1500m. Medals were also awarded in the mens and womens 4x100m and 4x400m relays

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Zoe is still shaken by the shooting, but the police insist it wasnt a targeted attack. The Slaters welcome her home but she finds it too overwhelming and rushes out. Tensions rise between Okie and Harry, and Georges suspicions are raised. Kim considers driving again, Julie reveals shes got a new job at Walford High and Alfie offers Zack the role of chef at the Vic

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Zoes fears continue to grow, despite Kat and Anthonys best efforts to reassure her. Worried shes putting everyone in danger, Zoe packs her belongings - but Stacey pleads with her to stay. Ravi is set on putting George out of action, so Harry enlists Kojos help to convince him to take Phils offer of a boxing tour. Ross takes on a second job, leaving Vicki to take on more responsibilities with Joel

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey and Zoe stake out Gregs place. Vicki is furious to learn Joel has played truant from school to attend the podcast recording event, and she turns to Julie for help with his behaviour. Lauren feels guilty when Louies present doesnt arrive in time for his birthday. Cindy suggests Peter should move in to help with the children

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Jack is set on revealing the truth about Zoes shooting, so Denise turns to Ravi for help. Julie attempts to talk to Joel about his misogynistic beliefs - but it may not be enough

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: The film show may be over but the raw emotions seem likely to continue long after. The couples split into two groups and head off for days out on separate islands - unaware that castaways, some of whom are all too familiar, plan to gatecrash their parties. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: The events of castaway day cause a tidal wave across Honeymoon Island. A crate washes up to give the honeymooners some much-needed support from home, before one husband is left with a shocking decision to make. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: The recent flare-up causes suspicion and speculation among the remaining honeymooners - and even some of the strongest couples start to feel the strain of stranded life. At the Couples Cove Masquerade Ball, the arrival of an unexpected guest sends shockwaves through the group. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.title: Ibiza: Secrets of the Party Island
programme.desc: Zara McDermott delves into the dark economy that keeps the drugs flowing in Ibiza, meeting with the drug supplier who never deals on the streets but feeds a seemingly never-ending supply of Class A drugs to demanding clientele all over the island. She also speaks to the police officers on the front line who are trying to cope with the excessive drug use, often allowing users with small supplies to walk away in order to target the dealers in the act of selling. Officers explain how social media has made their jobs much more difficult and Zara follows as they raid a luxury car rental company next to the main airport

programme.title: Ibiza: Secrets of the Party Island
programme.desc: Zara McDermott meets Spains top lawyer when it comes to defending drug traffickers, Ricardo Alvarez-Ossorio, and joins the Spanish Civil Guard as they tackle organised crime and drug trafficking across the country. While on a night shift with an ambulance crew, Zara speaks to a nurse who explains how Ibiza is the ideal testing ground for new drugs

programme.title: We Built a Zoo
programme.desc: Documentary following 19-year-old TikTok star Kyle Thomas as he attempts to build a zoo for exotic species and separate himself from past controversy with animal rights activists. He enlists the help of farmer and builder Phil Hughes and together the pair plan on turning Phils modest petting farm into a world-class sanctuary for unwanted exotic animals

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Comedy, written by and starring Mawaan Rizwan, following one mans quest for attention from anyone wholl give it to him. After splitting up with Guy, Jamma is now between jobs and sleeping on Winnies sofa. However, when he unexpectedly sees Guy for the first time in six months at Isaacs pop-up art exhibition, the spark between the exes is undeniable. To Jamma and Guys surprise a handsome stranger takes a special interest in their relationship status. With Russell Tovey

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Guys double-booked himself, so asks Jamma to house-sit and let a builder in. Jamma finds Guys manuscript about exes, but on discovering hes not included is sent into a spiral. Isaac comes over to calm Jamma down, but the pair discover Saif pampering himself in the house. Farida arrives with divorce papers and a new showbiz career to show off about. Sitcom, written by and starring Mawaan Rizwan and Russell Tovey

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Its the Big Beanbag Bash Day and Love Monster is very excited to throw some beanbags and win some games. Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny does better than he does, and Love Monster feels jealous of the attention that she gets. He becomes so frustrated that he kicks a beanbag and it hurtles towards the scoreboard, knocking all the points to the ground, ripping the bunting and giving Delivery Duckling, Elder Chick, Elder Panda and the In-Chicks a fright. The crowd is stunned into silence. Love Monster is horrified at what he has done and immediately says sorry. He explains that he wants everyone to cheer for him like they cheer for Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny. She admits it did feel good and tingly inside when everyone was cheering for her, but she says that everyone has something they are good at and Love Monster is the best beatboxer in Fluffytown. Love Monster realises that she is right and starts beatboxing. The Fluffytowners start having fun again and begin cheering for him.

programme.desc: Woodys friends are dismayed to find his English jaunt has turned him into a snob, while Frasier has problems with fitness trainer Sam. Starring Ted Danson, Woody Harrelson and Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra shocks Ray by revealing she would like more time alone, making him fear their marriage may be heading for the rocks. Comedy, starring Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra plays amateur psychiatrist to discover why a convalescing Robert is driving everyone crazy with his mean-spirited behaviour. American comedy, starring Brad Garrett and Patricia Heaton

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra suffers from PMT, so Ray decides to help alleviate her symptoms - but only succeeds in making matters worse. Ray Romano stars

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Daphnes ex-fiance Clive visits Seattle to declare his undying love and ask her to marry him. Rather than saying she cannot see a future for them, she decides to let him down gently and pretends to be Niless wife. With David Hyde Pierce and Jane Leeves

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Roz talks Frasier into going on a blind date with one of her friends - but Bulldog ends up falling in love with her. Meanwhile, a spelling mistake in an advert causes trouble for Niles, and Daphne accidentally destroys Martins favourite shoes. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and Dan Butler

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Brother, Can You Spare Two Dimes?
programme.desc: Homers destitute half-brother Herb turns up on the doorstep, just as Homer earns $2,000 as compensation for an injury at work. The impoverished sibling convinces him to invest in his latest invention and sure-fire moneyspinner - a baby translator. Featuring the guest voice of Danny DeVito

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart and Lisa are thrilled when their parents send them to Kamp Krusty for the summer - but when they arrive, they discover that having fun will not be high on the agenda. Animated antics, with the voices of Dan Castellaneta, Nancy Cartwright and Yeardley Smith

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Craig Rowe helps social worker Jacqui and health and safety officer Michael to hunt for their dream holiday home in Abruzzo in Italy. Theyve always dreamed of finding a great home in the mountain villages that one day could become their permanent home. Craig manages to find five properties within Jacquis £70,000 budget

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: An actress moves up the four-wheel property ladder, from a one-bed tiny transit to a two-bedroom luxury Luton Van conversion. A train carriage gets a makeover into a dog-friendly holiday let and George visits an amazing underground bar as well as a house in Denmark that is completely covered in seashells. The saga of the scissor-lift cabin continues, as George and Will Hardie get to grips with some serious weight issues

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are in Surrey, where space is a key requirement for their house-hunting families. Elise and Elliot have already seen the house they love but its way over budget, leaving Kirstie the tricky task of finding something cheaper that matches their dream home. Phil Spencer is with Kim and Ralph, who, along with their two children under five, are bursting out of Kims two-bedroom starter flat. They desperately want a taste of the space they grew up with in Zimbabwe - but close to their extended family in Horley

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer head to Strathaven, Lanarkshire to help Frank and Wilma decide whether to sell their four-bedroom family home or invest in it to make it work for them. Frank is firmly on Team Love It, having raised their two children there, he is convinced they still have many happy years to come in the house, while Wilma is ready to sell now that their kids have flown the nest. Kirstie grapples with a poorly placed conservatory and a kitchen diner that struggles to fit the extend ed family in as she creates a plan to renovate while Phil is put through his paces trying to convince Frank to swap suburban life for sea views

programme.title: Worst House on the Street
programme.desc: Carl and Lynn have bought a bungalow in Leeds, in the hope of being mortgage-free for retirement. But they need all the help they can get from Stuart and Scarlette Douglas to turn it around quickly so that they can move in

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The bakers are hoping for a Hollywood handshake this week as they tackle bread, the steely-eyed judges speciality. They begin by putting their stamp on a pull-apart monkey bread in the signature challenge, before being asked to make a sticky, messy, fast food technical. For the showstopper, they serve up sweet bread in tiers. Sadly, for one baker, this will be their last day in the tent. Who will be dusting themselves off and hanging up their apron?

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.sub-title: Formula 1 Azerbaijan Grand Prix Qualifying Highlights
programme.desc: Steve Jones presents action from the battle for grid positions for the 17th round of the season from the Baku City Circuit. Charles Leclerc claimed the pole position on the starting grid at last years race, clocking the fastest lap time in both the first and third qualifying sessions. His former Ferrari teammate Carlos Sainz Jr was third fastest in qualifying, but he was joined on the front row by McLarens Oscar Piastri, who was second quickest. With analysis from Billy Monger and Alice Powell

programme.title: Britains Railway Empire in Colour
programme.desc: Investigating how the rail compartment fascinated the Victorians as a place of intrigue and romance. As the 20th century dawned, railways continued to expand across the Empire. The Trans-Australia Railway was built. In South Africa, the railways played a key role in the Boer War and a battle for an armoured train made Winston Churchill famous. Railways were forced to adapt to world events - transporting soldiers in two World Wars and employing women in key roles for the first time. Hundreds of black and white photographs and reels of film survive from those tumultuous times. The latest technology restores the archive, bringing the story of rail back to life

programme.title: The Creator
programme.desc: Grief-stricken ex-Special Forces operative Joshua hopes to end the war between humans and a rogue artificial intelligence by locating and destroying the architect of the enemy machines. Dystopian sci-fi action thriller, starring John David Washington, Gemma Chan and Ken Watanabe

programme.title: Peppermint
programme.desc: Los Angeles bank worker Riley North is devastated when her husband and daughter are killed in cold blood on the order of a powerful drug lord, especially when the criminals escape justice. Withdrawing from society, this mild-mannered mother goes off grid - and while grieving for the loss of her loved ones, she turns herself into a one-woman killing machine, before returning from the shadows to exact her revenge. Thriller, starring Jennifer Garner, Jeff Hephner and Juan Pablo Raba

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Arvada, Colorado, where a husband and wife have allowed their restaurant to fall into disrepair. Randys hoarding is out of control, while Alexa, who runs the kitchen, has a lot to learn. To make matters worse, the Old Neighborhood is one of the filthiest eateries the fiery chef has ever seen, and only one of the biggest transformations of the series can save the business

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics are called to a rare and unusual stomach condition thats left a patient in agony. On the night shift, a young man is intoxicated and passed out in the street. An elderly man has fallen at home and cant get back up, and a confused and disorientated woman has one of the highest blood pressure readings the paramedics have ever seen

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.sub-title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes: Season by Season
programme.desc: Documentary following life during winter in the Yorkshire Dales and the Lake District. In Grasmere, father-and-son shepherding team Peter and Robert Bland have worked Herdwick sheep all their lives. Theyre heading up the fell, like they do every season, to gather their sheep. This time, the flock must be brought to the farm for pregnancy testing, to see how busy spring will be. Not all journeys to school are the same, and in Hawes in the rural Yorkshire Dales, the local bus service goes above and beyond to ensure all pupils get to school, no matter where they live. Narrated by Ian McMillan

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer catch up with two pairs of house-hunters. Requiring three bedrooms and space for three cars, as well as their dog, Jodie and Andy finally found what they were looking for in Portsmouth, and although the negotiations didnt work out, that wasnt the end of their story. In Stansted, Phil finds out whether Jocelyn and Simons dream of a rural idyll was ever completely satisfied

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Brother, Can You Spare Two Dimes?
programme.desc: Homers destitute half-brother Herb turns up on the doorstep, just as Homer earns $2,000 as compensation for an injury at work. programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Rebecca meets her high-school sweetheart and falls for him all over again - but he does not share her fantasies about getting married. Plus, the theft of Sams sports car results in him setting up a victims support group. Bar-room comedy, starring Ted Danson and Kirstie Alley

programme.sub-title: Bar Wars VI - This Time Its for Real
programme.desc: The traditional battle between the Old Towne Tavern and Cheers takes a new turn when the former comes under new management. programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Norm tricks Cliff into thinking that material he has sent to Johnny Carsons The Tonight Show has been accepted - but the joke soon rebounds on the joker. Starring Ted Danson and George Wendt

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert returns to work after sick leave, but is soon driven to the conclusion that he does not have the nerve to be a policeman any more and decides to pursue a safer career in telemarketing

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert bumps into his ex-wife, and considers rekindling the relationship. Meanwhile, Frank tells Amy the story of how the pair split up in the first place

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: A recurring dream makes Frasier wonder whether he is gay, prompting him to search for an explanation of its meaning - with a little help from Niles. Comedy, with Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.desc: Martin makes friends with reclusive author TH Houghton, to the considerable dismay of Niles and Frasier, who are frustrated that their own attempts to strike up an acquaintance have failed dismally. programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge astonishes Homer and the kids by landing the role of Blanche DuBois in an amateur production of A Streetcar Named Desire - and her performance is boosted by her frustration with Homer. With the guest voice of Jon Lovitz

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart misbehaves once too often, prompting Homer and Marge to impose a terrible punishment - banning him from ever going to see the new feature-length Itchy and Scratchy film, and standing firm despite his constant pleas

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This weeks competition kicks off at The Red Lion in Charing Heath, Kent, where the owners treat the other hosts to a masterclass in hospitality at nearby Leeds Castle

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition continues in Battle in East Sussex, at Dean and Beckys Glamp in Style campsite. The hosts have novelty on their side, with their unique accommodation including a converted army truck, a horsebox and a vintage bus but not everyone is keen to embrace the alternative glamping experience. In the afternoon, Becky lets loose with a saucy tale amid the local fauna and flora and at feedback time, cold water leaves the hosts feeling the heat

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Best friends Helen and Phil host the weeks third visit at Tottington Manor in West Sussex. Sam and Claudia are bowled over by the decor, but some guests raise their eyebrows at the high prices. An afternoon at a local rum distillery makes Helen and Phil the toast of the town. The hosts cant stop smiling when they run through their feedback - until some comments right at the end spoil things and give Helen an axe to grind for payment day

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Sam and Claudia host the weeks final visit at their self-catering Lakeview Studios in Dorset. The digs get approving eyes from Claire and Lee, but Dean and Beckys arrival is marked by a problem with their toilet. Ahead of the all-important payment day, battle lines are drawn at a tank museum

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Payment Day promises to be a fiery affair after two sets of BandBers in particular participated in tit-for-tat marking throughout the week. Eventually, the weeks winner is announced

programme.desc: Steve Jones presents action from the 17th round of the season, held at the Baku City Circuit. McLarens Oscar Piastri led the standings going into this race, with his teammate and nearest challenger Lando Norris 31 points behind. It was Piastri who took the honours here last year, with Ferraris Charles Leclerc finishing second and George Russell of Mercedes completing the podium. With analysis from Billy Monger and Alice Powell

programme.title: Educating Yorkshire
programme.desc: Year sevens Ismaeel, an enthusiastic ball of energy with his sights set on becoming a student representative for his year, canvasses classmates in the school playground, taking his list to school head Mr Burton who agrees to his real passion project - launching a brand-new chess club. Specialist teacher Mrs Burton is determined to help Lewis in year nine, a star student who was diagnosed with autism at the age of eight, come up with inventive ways to build his confidence - including the new chess club. Assistant Head Mrs Delaney-Hudson is determined not to give up on bright and charming year eight student Jacob who struggles to stay put in lessons

programme.title: The Inheritance
programme.desc: The latest elimination has shifted the balance of power within the estate, exposing the players true intentions as they scramble to secure their place in the game. As alliances and money become more important than ever, whispers, deceit and betrayal ripple through the group

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on programmes including The Inheritance, Long Lost Family, Unknown Number: The High School Catfish, The Yorkshire Vet, Dish It Out and Street Cops: Catching the Yobs. They also appraise ITV News coverage of Peter Mandelsons sacking and street protests in London

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: The Traitors 2023 finalist, Aaron, enters the restaurant looking for love and ends up paired with straight-A student Laura. Krissy returns to the dating scene for the first time after becoming a first-time mum at age 51 and ends up paired with chauffeur-to-the-stars, Rob. British Sign Language user Shaun is hoping his Mr Bean impression will impress party-loving Carly and Retail assistant Neil roller-skates into the restaurant looking for someone who accepts him just the way he is

programme.title: Love Cheats
programme.desc: The story of a man whose partner convinced him she had terminal cancer, and that she had a miscarriage. Devastated by the news, he doubled down on supporting her and goes to work renovating the home of her friend. What he discovers at that house unravels the many layers of deception that she has been weaving

programme.title: The Guilty
programme.desc: Asger, a frustrated and troubled cop, is mired in a mysterious workplace controversy and has been confined to the emergency response help lines while the issue is resolved. He gets a confusing call from a woman named Iben, who appears to be in immediate danger after being abducted by her partner. Asger tries to piece together where she is and how to get help to her. Writer/director Gustav Mollers crime drama, starring Jakob Cedergren. In Danish

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Queens, New York, where he meets a family torn apart by the stress of running failing Greek restaurant Kati Allo. Husband-and-wife owners Manny and Christine are on the brink of divorce, while their daughter Evelyn is caught in the middle and at her wits end

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: American comedian and actress Desiree Burch joins Joe Lycett for some snow-filled shenanigans in the city of Rovaniemi - the official home of Santa Claus - in Finnish Lapland on the edge of the Arctic Circle. The pair try out ice floating by donning rubber suits and climbing into a freezing lake. After they thaw out, they head for a five-course tasting menu inspired by Lappish ingredients including reindeer. On day two, Joe and Desiree experience ice fishing, ride in a traditional Sami reindeer caravan, learn some local handicrafts and look for the Northern lights

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces

programme.desc: The architect prepares to unveil his multi-functional treehouse in the grounds of Kielder Water and Forest Park in Northumberland, and meets a couple with big plans to build a theatre in a 1970s caravan. Plus, a man who has created a pub in his garden shed, and a 19th-century shepherds hut undergoes restoration using Victorian steam-powered machinery

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild
programme.desc: Ben travels to Southeast Asia, meeting entrepreneur Niall who now helps the countrys street-dogs after trading in his previous career. The pair explore his self-built dog sanctuary on the island of Koh Samui, where Ben is joined by volunteers and other dog-loving locals to help out with daily chores. Niall and Ben prepare food for the pooches in the sanctuary and across the island, before making dog beds from oil drums and a canine splash-pool

programme.title: Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild
programme.desc: Ben heads to northern England to stay with a man who traded in his house for a life on the road, travelling the UK and joining a community of full-time nomads who survive off the grid. Ben meets Paul in Lincolnshire on board his 30-year-old converted military truck. They travel to the coastline to stay overnight on the beach, go on a road trip and meet up with Pauls nomadic community. Along the way, Ben is intrigued how such a lifestyle is possible in the UK, with its strict camping laws

programme.title: Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild
programme.desc: Ben visits Sri Lanka to stay with Naveen and Anke at their home in the countrys highlands. They discuss why they moved away from civilisation, the struggles they had settling into their new lives and if they mean to entirely sever their ties with the outside world. Ben makes himself useful fixing a burst pipe, rendering walls with cow dung and making supply trips to a town

programme.title: Susan Calmans Grand Day Out
programme.desc: Susan heads to the lush county of Cumbria. Spanning the Lake District and North Pennines, this area looks like it is straight out of a storybook. Susan meets a storyteller laureate, before taking to the largest lake in England on the ideal boat for a Swallows and Amazons-style adventure

programme.title: Susan Calmans Grand Day Out
programme.desc: The comedian goes on a trip to the north-east corner of England, taking in the Pennines and Northumberland coast. Susan enjoys a stretch of Heritage Coast and the rolling countryside of the North Pennines. She also explores the Northumberland National Park

programme.title: Secret Life of the Forest
programme.desc: Its the height of summer in Dalby and Cropton Forests and the inhabitants are making the most of the abundance the warm weather provides. The young beaver kits bond with the rest of the family as they learn how to groom and chew through bark, two important skills they need to master. This episode also looks back at the history of the Lumberjills, the affectionate name given to the women who worked in the forest during the Second World War as part of the womens Timber Corps

programme.title: Secret Life of the Forest
programme.desc: With autumn well on its way, much of the wildlife in Dalby and Cropton Forests prepares for the new season and all that it brings. Over at the beaver pond, ecologist Cath is keeping a close eye on the family, as the older siblings begin to show signs of causing conflict in the wider group. Apprentice forester Holly masters using a chainsaw as the team cut down trees that could be risky to the public

programme.title: Michael Portillo in Andalucia
programme.desc: Michael visits Cordoba, focusing on the history of different civilisations that have influenced what it is to be Andalucian today, before entering Mesquita, considered to be one of the worlds greatest Islamic buildings. He also meets a family who use an ancient Roman technique to keep their courtyard cool and helps out in a local restaurant, where he learns how certain dishes have shaped the culture

programme.title: Michael Palin in Venezuela
programme.desc: Michael explores the country, a huge and once oil-rich nation that has been called the most dangerous in South America, which contrasts with its beautiful scenery. In this edition, Michael finds investigative reporter Ana Vanessa Herrero to hear about the shock re-election of Nicolás Maduro as President and the countrys slide into totalitarian rule

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the days headlines from around the world

programme.title: The Kings Grandchildren: Growing Up Rich
programme.desc: As proud grandparents, King Charles and Queen Camilla have 10 grandchildren between them, with some being princes and princesses while others have more normal existences outside the media spotlight. This programme examines the lives of the royal grandchildren and looks at how the King and Queen might navigate the complex dynamics of this very modern family

programme.title: Secrets of the Royal Palaces
programme.desc: The history of Hampton Courts Great Hall, a huge dining area built by more than 400 stonemasons, bricklayers, carpenters, joiners and labourers that was also used by Henry VIII to keep an eye on his household. Plus, a look at the 2002 Golden Jubilee Party, which was held in the grounds of Buckingham Palace and is considered to have changed the publics perception of monarchy

programme.title: Kate: Judge My Work, Not My Clothes
programme.desc: Since the Princess of Wales married into the royal family the press has been obsessed by what she wears and how she looks, but in February an article suggested she would prefer the world to focus on the substance of her work rather than her style. This documentary takes a look at how the Princess of Wales passion for fashion and dedication to the causes she supports have been interlinked right from the start, and explores whether the medias obsession with her wardrobe has overshadowed the incredible work she does

programme.title: When TV Goes Horribly Wrong
programme.desc: Tony Blackburn narrates a compilation of on-air disasters from the 1960s, including Doris Days blouse bursting open unexpectedly and a candid interview with Muhammad Ali. Mickey Rooney has a bad day at the office plugging his short-lived sitcom, and there are bloopers from TV favourites including The Lucy Show, Gunsmoke and Star Trek. Contributors include Amanda Barrie, Freddie Parrot Face Davies, Simon Williams, Erin Murphy and Mark Lester

programme.title: Traffic Cops: Pursuit Squad One
programme.desc: Following the countrys highly trained police bikers, the UKs fastest responders who are always at the ready to race at top speed to save lives and catch suspects on the run. Near the end of a busy Bank Holiday weekend, biker cop Paul Buckley is called to a serious crash involving a car and motorbike in the North Yorkshire countryside. Tragically, the biker has died. Paul and colleagues begin piecing together how and why the collision occurred to work out if either the driver or rider could be to blame. Near York, after a disqualified driver fails to stop for police and goes off road and on the run, biker cop Paddy Green hunts down the runaway driver

programme.title: PlayOJO Live Casino Show

programme.title: Jason Watkins and Lady Jane Grey: A Tower of London Special
programme.desc: The actor tries to find the truth behind two family mysteries, with historian Tracy Borman helping discover whether he is related to John Brydges, the royal courtier responsible for overseeing the imprisonment and execution of Lady Jane Grey, Englands shortest-reigning queen. According to family legend, Jason could also be connected to another, even more famous figure, renowned Georgian author Jane Austen

programme.title: Holidaying with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: The singer visits the beautiful beaches of Mahe, one of the Seychelles most iconic islands. A trip across the palm-fringed island sees her creating a silk sarong before a trip to the market in the capital, Victoria

programme.title: Holidaying with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: The singer goes on safari in Laikipia, Kenya, a remote location famed for its wildlife and conservation. programme.title: Cornwall with Fern Britton

programme.title: Cornwall with Fern Britton

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with All the Thanksgivings

Guest starring Morgan Fairchild

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Joey tries to cover up Chandler and Monicas relationship - but only succeeds in making himself look stupid. Phoebe persuades Rachel to take a literature class with her, while Ross falls out with his co-workers, convinced one of them stole his prized sandwich

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Inappropriate Sister

programme.title: Friends

programme.title: Friends

programme.desc: The bakers are hoping for a Hollywood handshake this week as they tackle bread, the steely-eyed judges speciality. They begin by putting their stamp on a pull-apart monkey bread in the signature challenge, before being asked to make a sticky, messy, fast food technical. For the showstopper, they serve up sweet bread in tiers. Sadly, for one baker, this will be their last day in the tent. Who will be dusting themselves off and hanging up their apron?

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon upsets guest star Stephen Hawking when they play an online game of Words with Friends, until Howard advises him to let the scientist win. Elsewhere, Penny enrols in a college class, but decides to keep it a secret from Leonard. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Amy and Wil Wheaton get into a fight while filming Fun with Flags, Sheldon suffers the consequences of their fall-out. He ends up going to Penny for advice and after getting drunk, confronts the actor in a bid to make him apologise. Bernadette encourages Howard to move out of his mothers house

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The friends try to solve the mystery of Sheldons post-lunch activities, following him to a secret room where they discover how he chills out. Elsewhere, Leonard is jealous when Penny starts texting a classmate, but things quickly change when Alex gets flirty with him

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon feels undermined when his parking space at the university is allocated to Howard instead, and his determination to cling on to the spot causes a rift in the pairs friendship. However, the battle between the boys pales in comparison to that waged by Amy and Bernadette, whose disagreement on behalf of their significant others becomes increasingly personal. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: As part of the relationship agreement, Sheldon reluctantly has to take care of Amy when she gets sick, but she loves the extra attention so much she pretends to remain in poor health. Elsewhere, Howard tries to get some tips on manliness from Penny when he and Bernadette go to visit her father

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Milhouses parents get divorced, filling Homer with misgivings about the state of his own marriage. Determined not to drift apart from Marge, he begins making elaborate efforts to be considerate - but his efforts only make matters worse

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Glamorous Hollywood star Sara Sloane visits Springfield and becomes infatuated with Ned Flanders, who finds himself asking Homer for dating advice. Featuring the voices of Helen Fielding and Marisa Tomei

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Good, the Sad and the Drugly
programme.desc: Bart is on his best behaviour as he tries to win the affections of a girl at his school, while Lisa reports on what Springfield will look like in 50 years. With the voice of Anne Hathaway (Les Miserables)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The family go for a holiday at the seaside, where Homer is unwittingly tempted by a British femme fatale. With the guest voice of Olivia Colman

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Comic Book Guys origin story is revealed as he and his wife Kumiko debate having a baby

programme.title: Lego Masters Australia
programme.desc: As part of the 85th anniversary of DCs Batman, the teams have eight hours to create iconic vehicles for some of Batmans most notorious foes, to earn a spot in the semi-final. Each team is given an infamous Batman villain - from The Joker to Harley Quinn and Poison Ivy - and must construct a vehicle and a good-versus-evil Gotham City battle scene

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
programme.desc: A cabaret singer who once hid out in a convent is reunited with the nuns she befriended, who now need her help. She poses as a member of the order once more and joins the staff of a Catholic school threatened with closure, where she aims to make a success of the resident choir. Comedy sequel, starring Whoopi Goldberg, Kathy Najimy, Lauryn Hill, Maggie Smith and James Coburn

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: The return of the experiment to see whether science can help people fall in love. The first two couples marry at first sight. While an unexpected surprise transforms one grooms big day, will another grooms impromptu musical outburst be a major turn-off for his bride?

programme.title: MAFS UK: Its Official!
programme.sub-title: MAFS UK: Its Official! With Lucinda Light
programme.desc: Lucinda Light hosts Married at First Sight UKs official podcast, dissecting all the latest drama from the show, with celebrity guests, brides, grooms and the MAFS UK relationship experts. In this edition, she is joined by British drag performer and singer Danny Beard

programme.title: Virgin Island
programme.desc: Documentary following 12 adult virgins as they embark on a unique course in intimacy at a luxury Mediterranean retreat, to see if it can help them overcome the fears. In this first episode, the group arrive at the island retreat and learn more about the hands-on therapy, while the experts begin to get to grips with their issues. The group learn to cope with rejection and tune in to their innermost sexual desires

programme.title: Open House: The Great Sex Experiment
programme.desc: Nicolle and Ben arrive at the retreat keen to spice up their seven-year relationship by having sex with other people. However, when Nicolle reveals that shes a people pleaser who finds it hard to say no, Dr Lori warns the couple that Nicolle needs to vocalise her feelings. The pair invite resident couple Kiki and Sophia to spend some intimate time with them in the hot tub, and the fun continues in the bedroom. But is Nicolle as happy with the nights sexual climax as she seems? Meanwhile, thrill-seekers Katey and Dan pursue a live sex show experience

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: The return of the experiment to see whether science can help people fall in love. The first two couples marry at first sight. While an unexpected surprise transforms one grooms big day, will another grooms impromptu musical outburst be a major turn-off for his bride?

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Twenty six-year-old graphic designer Charlie says that some people describe her optimism as relentless. Shes matched with 25-year-old Australian osteopath Benj, who loves to talk about his feelings and is fond of a cry. Bus driver Tommy and electrician Luke both agree that they hate dating apps and hook-up culture. However, Luke then learns something about Tommy that leaves their date hanging by a thread. Stephen is divorced with two kids, hes 46, and he works as a toiletry products salesman. He gives his date, 42-year-old mum-of-one Rachel, a lesson in loo paper. Will she be happy to roll with it?

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil is unable to hide his excitement when hes invited to appear in a real-estate segment for the local news and the day gets even better after meeting his weatherman hero Rainer Shine (guest star Nathan Fillion). Meanwhile, Jay decides to infuse a little grit into Mannys video interview for his college application, and Lily decides to take matters into her own hands over her new house guest

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Leela worries about Ste when he doesnt come home, while Dillon jumps to conclusions, and Jez plans a memorial for Sienna. After a bumpy start, sparks begin to fly between two former lovers, theres a shocking discovery in a missing persons case, and Tom helps Tony to adapt to prison life. A resident gets backed into a corner, and a secret becomes too heavy to hold

programme.title: Wonder Park
programme.desc: June, a science-loving little girl, and her mother spend hours playing with stuffed animals and other toys, fashioning a world of imagination connected to a fabulous theme park. When Junes mom is diagnosed with a life-threatening illness and has to go away for treatment, June finds a real version of her theme park. Animated family adventure, with the voices of Mila Kunis, Jennifer Garner and Kenan Thompson

programme.title: Born Free
programme.desc: Oscar-winning fact-based drama chronicling the lives of game wardens Joy and George Adamson, who adopted an orphaned lion cub in Kenya and trained the animal to survive in the wild so that one day it might return to its natural habitat. Starring Virginia McKenna, Bill Travers and Geoffrey Keen

programme.title: Babe: Pig in the City
programme.desc: The pig and his farmyard pals take a trip to the big city, where their curiosity and love of adventure lands them in trouble, leaving the courageous Babe to find a way to save his chums from danger. Family comedy sequel, starring Magda Szubanski, Mickey Rooney and James Cromwell, and featuring the voice of Elizabeth Daily as Babe

programme.title: The Devil Wears Prada
programme.desc: A woman with dreams of becoming a journalist takes a job as assistant to the editor of a prestigious fashion magazine - a position that should guarantee a bright future if she succeeds. Unfortunately, she has just signed up to work for the boss from hell, whose cruel personality and outrageous demands make her life a nightmare. Comedy drama, with Meryl Streep, Anne Hathaway, Stanley Tucci and Emily Blunt

programme.title: Jumanji: The Next Level
programme.desc: Players of Jumanji return, but as they attempt to rescue one of their own, they will have to brave parts unknown from arid deserts to snowy mountains, to escape the worlds most dangerous game. Director Jake Kasdans fantasy adventure sequel to his 2017 rebooted hit Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle, starring Dwayne Johnson, Karen Gillan, Kevin Hart and Jack Black

programme.title: The Mechanic
programme.desc: A professional hitman lets his emotional detachment slip when his mentor is murdered, and puts his deadly skills to the task of getting revenge. The solitary assassin finds an ally in his teachers son, who also yearns for vengeance and persuades the killer to teach him the tricks of the trade. Action thriller remake, starring Jason Statham, Ben Foster and Donald Sutherland.

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: New York cop John McClane visits Los Angeles to see his family over the Christmas holiday. Stopping off at his wifes place of work, he realises armed men have taken over the building and are holding the corporations staff to ransom - and only he has the ability to fight back. Action thriller, starring Bruce Willis, Alan Rickman and Bonnie Bedelia

programme.title: Ravenous
programme.desc: A mysterious Scotsman regales a group of 19th-century American soldiers with stomach-churning tales of cannibalism. As the troops trek across the mountains in search of evidence to support his claims, it becomes obvious the shifty Scot is hiding a secret. Horror, starring Guy Pearce, Robert Carlyle, David Arquette, Jeremy Davies and Jeffrey Jones

programme.title: Kind Hearts and Coronets
programme.desc: The penniless grandson of a duke plots to eliminate the eight relatives standing between him and a vast inheritance. He shoots, drowns, poisons and explodes his way through his family tree, but his final triumph is ruined when his lady loves husband kills himself. Ealing black comedy, starring Alec Guinness as all eight potential victims, with Dennis Price, Valerie Hobson and Joan Greenwood

programme.title: Think Like a Dog
programme.desc: A 12-year-old tech prodigys science experiment goes awry and he forges a telepathic connection with his dog. The duo join forces and use their unique perspectives on life to overcome complications of family and school. Family comedy drama, starring Josh Duhamel, Megan Fox and Gabriel Bateman

programme.title: Dunston Checks In
programme.desc: A gentleman jewel thiefs pet orang-utan runs amok in a swanky hotel, causing endless problems for the put-upon manager who has enough on his plate trying to ensure the establishment successfully attains a six-star rating. Family comedy, starring Jason Alexander, Rupert Everett, Faye Dunaway, Eric Lloyd and Paul Reubens

programme.title: Secret Headquarters
programme.desc: Fourteen-year-old Charlie Kincaid yearns for a deeper connection to his father Jack, who frequently disappears at short notice for work. When an IT conference interrupts Charlies birthday, the teenager invites friends to a party at his fathers house, and they stumble upon a subterranean, gizmo-laden lair. Comedy adventure, starring Owen Wilson, Walker Scobell and Michael Pena

programme.title: Fishermans Friends
programme.desc: A music executive heads out to a Cornish fishing village on a mission to recruit a group of 10 local fishermen into recording an album of sea shanties. He struggles to win over the unlikely boy band and their families, but begins to gain a new appreciation for their traditional values. Comedy, starring James Purefoy, Daniel Mays and Tuppence Middleton

programme.title: Wild Card
programme.desc: Las Vegas bodyguard Nick Wild finds himself dealing with more than just his gambling problem after he takes revenge on the criminal who attacked his friend, little realising that the thug in question is the son of a mob boss. Action thriller, starring Jason Statham, Michael Angarano and Milo Ventimiglia

programme.title: Glass
programme.desc: An invulnerable vigilante battles a murderer with multiple personalities - only for both to be apprehended and transferred to a psychiatric hospital. They find themselves under the care of a sinister doctor who has plans concerning their unique abilities, but also sharing the facility with a third patient, a criminal mastermind the crime fighter had encountered before, and who is soon manipulating everyone to his own ends. M Night Shyamalans fantasy thriller, crossing over the characters from his earlier films Unbreakable and Split. Starring James McAvoy, Bruce Willis and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: Benjamin
programme.desc: An up-and-coming filmmaker tries to balance a romance with a visiting French music student and the release of his second movie. A lot of time has elapsed since his acclaimed debut and Benjamin is concerned that his follow-up will be a disaster. Writer/director Simon Amstells comedy drama, starring Colin Morgan, Jack Rowan and Anna Chancellor, with cameos from Mark Kermode and Simon Mayo

programme.title: The High Chaparral
programme.desc: Big John is suffering from exhaustion and the apparent cure is to spend some time away from the ranch. He and Victoria leave on a delayed honeymoon in San Francisco, but things at the ranch dont go too well as Buck, Blue and Manolito struggle to manage it alone

programme.title: Demetrius and the Gladiators
programme.desc: A Greek slave is forced into the gladiatorial service when he defends an elderly merchant from the attack of a sadistic centurion. But he also has the hallowed robe of Christ - which makes him the target of Emperor Caligula and the treacherous Messalina, because they believe it has special powers. However, the reluctant gladiator does not intend to give it up to them. Historical drama, starring Victor Mature, Susan Hayward, Michael Rennie and Debra Paget

programme.title: Stagecoach

programme.title: The Undefeated
programme.desc: A veteran Union officer crosses paths again with a former Confederate enemy years after the end of the Civil War - and their past animosity resurfaces. Western, with John Wayne, Rock Hudson, Lee Meriwether, Tony Aguilar and Roman Gabriel

programme.title: Sands of Iwo Jima
programme.desc: A tough, embittered US marine sergeant sets out to mould a group of raw recruits into men fit for action against the Japanese in the Pacific during the Second World War. Although his training methods are often brutal, his controversial approach looks set to pay dividends when they finally see real combat. Adventure, starring John Wayne, John Agar, Adele Mara and Forrest Tucker

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: A wealthy Texan hires four mercenaries to rescue his wife, who has been abducted and taken to Mexico by a bandit gang. However, when they find her, she refuses to leave and they have to take her by force - ending in a cross-border chase with the outlaws on their trail. Western adventure, with Burt Lancaster, Lee Marvin, Robert Ryan, Woody Strode, Jack Palance and Claudia Cardinale

programme.title: The Sweetest Christmas
programme.desc: Kylie, a struggling pastry chef, discovers she has secured a place in the finals of the American Gingerbread Competition. Spotting a chance to raise her profile - and perhaps jumpstart business at her new cafe - she enters, but her chances of winning are quickly slashed when her oven breaks down right before the contest. Determined to remain in the running, she appeals to her old boyfriend Nick, who gave up his education to take over his family pizzeria. He agrees to let her use his kitchens industrial ovens to craft her gingerbread delicacies, and as they pair work together, a familiar spark rekindles their old flame. Festive romance, starring Lacey Chabert and Lea Coco

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: Ill Be Waving as You Drive Away - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Just as Mary falls in love with newcomer Seth Barton, her eyesight begins to worsen. Charles takes her to an optometrist, but the news is not good - Marys vision cannot be saved and she will soon go blind. In denial, Charles does not tell his daughter until she finds to her horror she is completely blind. Mary becomes very bitter over her predicament and having to rely on others for basic needs. Drama, starring Michael Landon

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: Ill Be Waving as You Drive Away - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mary is sent to a blind school in Iowa, where she meets Adam Kendall. She refuses to accept his help at first, but he eventually helps her learn to deal with her blindness. When Adam encourages Mary before her return to Walnut Grove, he says a key line that serves as the title of this episode. Meanwhile, the town of Walnut Grove faces bankruptcy as its citizens prepare to move out

programme.sub-title: The Things We Do for Love
programme.desc: The discovery of a womans body in a car park presents Jack Frost with another challenge to his deductive powers. Delving into the victims electronic organiser, he learns she was connected with a local religious community - and realises someone in the congregation is more interested in the pleasures of this world than the rewards of the next. David Jason stars, with Bruce Alexander and John Lyons

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.sub-title: How Long Has This Been Going On?
programme.desc: Morwenna is back as receptionist and the Ellinghams have a new dog. Martin attends Stewarts survival course, but not as a participant like Al and Penhale. Louisa agrees to help Pippa by speaking at the school assembly alongside Mrs Tishell. Drama, starring Martin Clunes as a surgeon who is forced to retrain as a GP and takes up a post in a sleepy Cornish village where he soon finds himself at odds with the locals

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Martin rubs up against the new herbalist and Penhale, Louisa and James are all interested in Janices new pedicure fish. Martins ex-flame invites him to speak as keynote speaker at Imperial College, and Ruth is back from Mexico with more than maracas

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: Cast Not Your Pearls Before Swine - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Pop plans to build a swimming pool in the shape of Ma for her birthday surprise, while Charley and Mariette take a well-earned break in France. Starring David Jason and Catherine Zeta-Jones

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: Cast Not Your Pearls Before Swine - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Roger returns to Liverpool, while Pop discovers Ediths new boyfriend George is a con-artist defrauding the ministry - and resolves to teach him a lesson. David Jason stars

programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.desc: The sleuth helps an old friend find refuge at country house Greenshaws Folly, but a sinister shadow falls over the strange buildings various inhabitants and a murderer strikes. Miss Marple uncovers secrets from the past about Miss Greenshaw as a dangerous storm gathers and the bodies start to pile up. Julia McKenzie heads an all-star cast that includes Jim Moir (better known as Vic Reeves), Kimberley Nixon, Fiona Shaw, Robert Glenister, Julia Sawalha, Judy Parfitt and Matt Willis (formerly of pop group Busted)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A murder at a remote cottage in Northumberland takes DCI Vera Stanhope back to a place full of childhood memories and reminds her of an unsolved case from earlier in her career. Delving into the local politics surrounding a controversial proposal to dig a quarry, she and her team find motives in the unlikeliest of places - until they realise that the truth could be hidden within the land itself. Detective drama, adapted from Ann Cleeves novel The Crow Trap, guest starring Daniela Nardini (This Life) alongside Brenda Blethyn

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Joyce Barnaby swerves off the road into a ditch, convinced she has hit someone, but nobody is found injured and Tom thinks she has imagined it. However, when a local historian discovers the body of a librarian in a nearby cemetery, Joyce blames herself for the mans death, leading her husband into a spooky investigation to find the real killer on the loose in the haunted village of March Magna. Guest starring Danny Webb (The Bill), with John Nettles, Jason Hughes and Jane Wymark

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the owners of Karras Games gather for a murder mystery weekend, the immersive experience takes a puzzling twist when a killer strikes for real. Gathering at Hulton Manor, a sprawling edifice on its own island, a storm rages outside adding to the immersive experience of the fictional murder playing out in front of them, until one of them tumbles down the stairs, and is impaled by a life-size Egyptian figure - killing him for real

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates when the body of a wildlife ranger is found on a remote island off the coast of Northumberland. Her death is at first assumed to be an accident, since she was alone on the island when she died, but marks on the body seem to point to murder. As Vera delves into the dead womans personal life, she uncovers dark secrets and old resentments

programme.title: Shetland
programme.desc: Perez interviews Andrea Doyle. Initially petulant, she quickly becomes scared when he explains the charges against her, and reluctantly agrees to show him the safe house. The detectives are horrified to discover Nikkis body dumped in the garden of the property, wrapped in bin liners. A distraught Olivia comes dangerously close to driving herself and Jamie Hayes off the edge of a cliff, while a hungover Duncan makes a shocking discovery when he wakes up on the beach. Douglas Henshall and Therese Bradley star

programme.title: Shetland
programme.desc: Olivia has almost given up hope of ever finding her daughter, and Perez tries to reassure her when some terrible news reaches them. Perez and Tosh arrive at Spiggie Beach to see body bags lined up in a row on the sand. They guess that the people were the next shipment being trafficked to the islands, and when the traffickers realised their operation had been compromised, they abandoned them at sea. Piecing the case together, Perez closes in on Zezis location, but can he reach her before its too late?

programme.title: Joanna Lumleys Home Sweet Home - Travels in My Own Land
programme.desc: Starting in the Outer Hebrides, Joanna explores the Harris tweed industry, and drives a herd of Highland cattle across the sands at low tide to their winter grazing. Next she heads to Eilean Donan Castle, the location for her first episode of The New Avengers. Crossing to Northern Ireland, Joanna visits the Dark Hedges, made famous in Game of Thrones, before having a laugh with one of the Derry Girls. She then meets the inspiring founder of the Children in Crossfire charity

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Dour DI Jack Frost suspects a man he arrested years before for a series of bizarre assaults on children could have returned to the area and recommenced his unsavoury activities. He tracks down the culprit, who swears he has turned over a new leaf, and decides not to charge him - a decision that shocks fellow sleuth DS Maud, whose misgivings are later justified in tragic fashion. Starring David Jason, Peter Gunn, Susannah Doyle, Bruce Alexander, John Lyons and Gwyneth Powell

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective begins to suspect something is amiss when he visits one of his favoured haunts in London for dinner and discovers a fellow regular has dramatically changed his diet. Down in Brighton, elderly Anthony Gascoigne lies dying while his estranged twin brother Henry falls to his death - but nobody is sure whether the man was deliberately pushed. Bizarrely, the key to the riddle seems to lie in a blackberry pie. David Suchet stars in the title role, with Philip Jackson, Hugh Fraser and Pauline Moran

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: Morses investigation into a number of untimely death notices in the Oxford Mail, each with a cryptic message, takes him to a series of funerals before forcing him to confront his own mortality. Thursday is facing more than one confrontation of his own as his past closes in on him, while he resorts to desperate measures to protect those he loves most. Final episode of the Inspector Morse prequel, starring Shaun Evans and Roger Allam

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: Climb the Greasy Pole - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. A seat becomes vacant on the local council when Sam Popham is taken ill, so Pop stands in the election, and Mariette returns from holiday with Charley. David Jason stars

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: Climb the Greasy Pole - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Pop and Ma become the target of dirty tricks and smear tactics during the election campaign, and Charley is placed in a compromising position by Abigails teacher

programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.desc: Newlyweds Mike and Ellie decide to build their dream home at a beauty spot called Gypsys Acre, ignoring the warnings of elusive romany Mrs Lee about an ancient curse supposedly cast upon the land. The couple settle into their new life, but the mysterious woman makes her presence felt, subjecting them to a campaign of hatred in an attempt to force them out. Tragedy soon strikes, but as luck would have it Miss Marple is staying nearby with her recently widowed old friend Mrs Phillpot. However, if the spinster sleuth is to solve the puzzle, she must put her own life in grave danger. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, with Wendy Craig, Glynis Barber, Hugh Dennis, Tamzin Outhwaite, Tom Hughes, Joanna Vanderham, Aneurin Barnard, William Hope and Janet Henfrey

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A woman is murdered in a hedgerow but her son survives the attack, only to fall beneath the ice of a frozen pond as he makes his escape. DCI Vera Stanhope wades in and drags him out, and against all the odds he pulls through. As the investigation into the mothers killing unfolds, Vera finds a kindred spirit in the boy and comes to realise the key to solving the case lies deep in his memory. Detective drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, with Kerry Fox and Kieran OBrien

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The annual Scarecrow Festival takes a grisly turn as bodies begin appearing on poles displayed alongside their straw creations. Barnaby and Winters investigation reveals rivalries that run deep and shows people will do just about anything to win. Neil Dudgeon stars

programme.title: The Road to Coronation Street
programme.desc: Jane Horrocks and Jessie Wallace star in a one-off drama telling the story of how the long-running soap was born. Tony Warren joins producer Harry Elton and director Derek Bennett as they struggle to create the programme, faced with opposition from ITVs formidable bosses Sidney and Cecil Bernstein, while Margaret Morris begins the hunt for the shows cast. With David Dawson, Stephen Berkoff, Celia Imrie and Lynda Baron

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa is shocked and Martin suspicious by the unannounced return of her father. Ruth is helping Martin with his blood phobia when she discovers his predicament, and an unexpected caravan squatter thwarts Berts dreams of making a quick buck

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective is drawn into Newcastles underworld to discover the identity of a murder victim found dead in the river, with no clue as to who he is apart from a distinctive drugs wrapper. She discovers the dead man had ties to some very dangerous people, many of whom may have wanted him dead, while a witnesss testimony links the case to a remote farm where a murder took place 13 years previously. The connection brings Kennys past back to haunt him, as he was responsible for seeing the perpetrator convicted

programme.title: I Fought the Law
programme.desc: At the retrial for Julies murder, the jury once again cannot reach a verdict. Ann finds herself at her lowest point as she faces the challenge of rebuilding her life while her daughters murderer is at large in the community. Horrifyingly, the killer begins to brag about how he got away with the perfect murder, knowing he is protected by the double jeopardy law. With the Crown having seemingly exhausted its powers, its down to Ann to find justice for Julie, launching a campaign to change the 800-year-old law

programme.title: I Fought the Law
programme.desc: Determined to overturn the double jeopardy law, Ann takes her fight for justice to the home secretary, while Julies son Kevin is now a teenager and starts to ask questions about how his mother really died. Anns crusade takes her to the House of Lords, where she speaks not as a politician but as a grieving mother, and wins them over unconditionally
