Sci-fi comedy sequel, directed by Barry Sonnenfeld, starring Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Rosario Dawson, Lara Flynn Boyle, Johnny Knoxville, Rip Torn and Tony Shalhoub

programme.title: Zombieland
programme.desc: A mutated virus sweeps across America, turning most of the population into hideous flesh-eating zombies. A hard-drinking fearless adventurer leads a small band of young survivors on a perilous journey through the wasteland in search of a safe haven. Comedy horror, with Woody Harrelson, Jesse Eisenberg, Emma Stone and Abigail Breslin

programme.title: I Am Legend
programme.desc: A Manhattan-based military scientist finds himself immune to a virus that turns humans into ferocious vampire-like creatures. After the disease has swept across the world, wiping out an estimated 90 per cent of the human population, he devotes his solitary existence to finding a cure by unlocking the secret within his blood. Sci-fi thriller, starring Will Smith, Alice Braga and Charlie Tahan

programme.title: Constantine
programme.desc: Exorcist John Constantine is cursed with the ability to see spirits stalking the Earth, and grudgingly takes on the forces of evil, hoping his actions will earn him a place in heaven. However, he is told he has terminal cancer and time for salvation is running out - unless a policewoman investigating her twin sisters death can find the key to saving his soul. Supernatural thriller, starring Keanu Reeves, Rachel Weisz and Tilda Swinton

programme.title: MaXXXine
programme.desc: In 1980s Hollywood, adult film star and aspiring actress Maxine Minx finally gets her big break. But as a mysterious killer stalks the starlets of Tinseltown, a trail of blood threatens to reveal her sinister past. The third instalment of director Ti Wests acclaimed X film series, starring Mia Goth, Lily Collins, Giancarlo Esposito and Kevin Bacon

programme.title: Total Recall
programme.desc: A man living in a bleak future years after a nuclear war has fake memories of being a secret agent implanted into his brain. However, the procedure uncovers the fact that he really is a spy with his memory erased, and he is forced to become a fugitive from the totalitarian government. Sci-fi thriller remake, with Colin Farrell, Kate Beckinsale and Jessica Biel

programme.title: Ouija
programme.desc: A teenager recovering from the suicide of a friend persuades a group of her classmates to join her in attempting to make contact with the dead girls spirit. They discover that she was driven to her death by dangerous supernatural forces, which they have unwittingly unleashed to prey on them. Horror, starring Olivia Cooke and Ana Coto

programme.title: Head Count
programme.desc: Prison escapee Kat is threatened by a mystery assailant, who points his own revolver to his head. Kat desperately tries to remember how many bullets are left as the empty rounds click away. Thriller, starring Aaron Jakubenko, Ryan Kwanten and Melanie Zanetti

programme.title: Barber
programme.desc: Private Investigator Val Barber is hired by a wealthy widow to find her missing granddaughter. Co-writer/director Fintan Connollys mystery drama, starring Aidan Gillen and Gary Lydon

programme.title: Eye in the Sky
programme.desc: Colonel Katherine Powells mission to wipe out a terrorist cell in Kenya is complicated when a girl enters the blast radius of the intended drone strike. Powell has to decide between sacrificing the girls life or letting the terrorists flee to carry out more atrocities. Thriller, starring Helen Mirren, Alan Rickman and Aaron Paul

programme.title: The Da Vinci Code
programme.desc: A respected academic goes on the run when he is framed for the murder of a French historian. Pursued by the detective on the case and a sinister assassin monk, he strives to unmask the culprit, leading to a conspiracy determined to preserve a 2,000-year-old secret at any cost. Thriller based on Dan Browns novel, starring Tom Hanks, Audrey Tautou, Ian McKellen, Paul Bettany and Jean Reno

programme.title: Vanilla Sky
programme.desc: The laid-back lifestyle of an arrogant New York playboy is shattered when his unstable girlfriend drives off a bridge with him in the car. Although he survives, he struggles to put his life back together in the face of a series of strange events. Cameron Crowes remake of Spanish thriller Open Your Eyes, starring Tom Cruise, Cameron Diaz, Kurt Russell, Jason Lee and Penelope Cruz, who also appeared in the original

programme.title: Patriot Games
programme.desc: Former CIA agent Jack Ryan foils an assassination attempt by an IRA splinter group, killing one of the terrorists in the process. However, he becomes caught in a lethal game of cat-and-mouse with the dead mans revenge-seeking brother. Thriller based on Tom Clancys novel, starring Harrison Ford, Sean Bean, Samuel L Jackson, Richard Harris and James Earl Jones, reprising his role from earlier Clancy adaptation The Hunt for Red October

programme.title: Angels and Demons
programme.desc: Academic adventurer Robert Langdon is called in by the Vatican to deal with a crisis. Pope Pius XVI has died suddenly and the four cardinals in line to be his successor have all been abducted by a mysterious sect that is threatening to murder them. As he searches for the kidnapped clerics, Langdon discovers the cult has an even more horrific plan in mind involving a stolen canister of anti-matter. Ron Howard takes the reins once again for the sequel to The Da Vinci Code, with Tom Hanks, Ewan McGregor, Ayelet Zurer, Stellan Skarsgard and Pierfrancesco Favino

programme.title: Law Abiding Citizen
programme.desc: A man is forced to witness the murder of his wife and daughter, and is driven to despair when one of the perpetrators walks free at trial. Years later, he begins a campaign of vigilante violence, seeking revenge on the killers and the justice system that failed to punish them, particularly an assistant district attorney who allowed the defendant to make a deal during the court proceedings. Thriller, with Gerard Butler and Jamie Foxx

programme.title: The Punisher
programme.desc: FBI agent Frank Castle enrages a powerful gangland kingpin when a gunfight accidentally causes the death of the mobsters son. The crime boss retaliates by wiping out Castles entire family, but the lawman reinvents himself as a vigilante, acting as judge, jury and executioner to the underworld. Thriller based on the Marvel comic-book anti-hero, starring Thomas Jane, John Travolta, Will Patton, Rebecca Romijn and Roy Scheider

programme.title: Lawless
programme.desc: Three brothers run an underground bootlegging operation in Depression-era Virginia. However, as their criminal activities become increasingly successful, a corrupt deputy sheriff demands a cut of the profits, forcing them to fight to defend their livelihood. Crime drama, starring Shia LaBeouf, Tom Hardy, Jason Clarke, Gary Oldman and Guy Pearce

programme.title: Caddo Lake
programme.desc: The disappearance of an eight-year-old girl ties together a series of past deaths and disappearances, as well as bringing the truth about a broken familys history into the light. Thriller written and directed by Logan George and Celine Held, starring Dylan OBrien and Eliza Scanlen

programme.title: Parallel
programme.desc: Grief-stricken after the loss of her child, a woman takes refuge at a lake house, only to be met with an aberration of herself from a parallel universe. Director Kourosh Aharis thriller, starring Danielle Deadwyler, Aldis Hodge and Edwin Hodge

programme.title: Patriot Games

Thriller based on Tom Clancys novel, starring Harrison Ford, Sean Bean, Samuel L Jackson, Richard Harris and James Earl Jones, reprising his role from earlier Clancy adaptation The Hunt for Red October

programme.title: Now You See Me
programme.desc: Four magicians use their lavish stage shows as cover for a series of seemingly impossible heists, and give away the money they steal to their audiences. An FBI agent assembles a team of experts to discover how the baffling robberies are committed and what the secret agenda behind the crime spree is. Crime thriller, starring Jesse Eisenberg, Mark Ruffalo, Woody Harrelson and Isla Fisher

programme.desc: Following his life-or-death missions in The Da Vinci Code, and Angels and Demons, long suffering expert Robert Langdon awakes with amnesia in an Italian hospital, and is soon on the run with a beautiful doctor. Director Edward Zwicks blockbusting action thriller sequel based on Lee Childs novel, starring Tom Cruise, Cobie Smulders, Danika Yarosh and Aldis Hodge

Comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson

Comedy drama, starring Dwayne Johnson and Rob Corddry

programme.title: Tina (2021)
programme.desc: Born Anna Mae Bullock in 1939, Tina Turner has sold in excess of 100 million records and earned numerous plaudits including Grammy awards and induction into the Rock And Roll Hall Of Fame with her first husband, Ike Turner. She was the first woman to grace the cover of Rolling Stone magazine and dabbled in acting including a memorable performance opposite Mel Gibson in Mad Max Beyond Thunderdome. Following a prolonged period of ill health, Turner intends to retire from the spotlight with her second husband, Erwin Bach. She bids farewell to her fans in the emotional documentary Tina. Directed by Dan Lindsay and TJ Martin, the film invites the singer to reminisce about her turbulent life and career with glowing contributions from friends, family and fans including Oprah Winfrey and Angela Bassett

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts sets off across Hadrians Wall to reveal the forgotten story of the Roman Armys secret weapon in Britain - their cavalry. programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts shares the best archaeological discoveries of 2018, starting with the North of the UK and a preserved prehistoric village at the black Loch in Myrton. The programme also follows archaeologists uncovering a previously unknown Anglo-Saxon cemetery in Lincolnshire, and a major regeneration project in Salford, unearthing the largest jail in Georgian England. Cameras join the hunt for a lost Second World War reconnaissance Spitfire in Norway and enjoy privileged access to the conservation labs at Vindolanda Roman fort to see what really happens when the digging stops

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.sub-title: West: Roman Bathhouse and Hessian Camp
programme.desc: Alice Roberts investigates the best archaeological discoveries of 2018 from the West of the UK, including the biggest maritime excavation since the Mary Rose which revealed the extraordinary story of the HMS Invincible, a buried German military camp in Hampshire, and a monumental Roman Bathhouse in Silchester

programme.title: UFOs Declassified

programme.title: UFOs Declassified
programme.desc: Exploring reports of sinister flying objects that were allegedly seen above secret military bases during the Cold War

programme.title: Combat Ships
programme.desc: Stories of hospital ships and those who served on them, including the tragic story of the sinking of the Titanics sister vessel, The Britannic

programme.title: Combat Ships

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice Roberts tells the story of Viking England by studying the history of York. She takes part in a Viking battle, meets the metal detectorists behind one of the UKs greatest archaeological finds and gets her hands on an almost 1,000-year-old poo. Aerial archaeologist Ben Robinson takes to the skies to see how the current layout of York reflects its history

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explores the Norman period of British history by examining events that occurred in Winchester, a historic town that still retains many hallmarks of the 11th and 12th centuries. To get a taste of this era, she attempts to storm a castle wearing chain mail, investigates the origins of modern surgery, and tries some eel pie. At the conclusion of the episode, cutting edge CGI is used to take the town back in time, and recreate how it would have looked during this period of British history

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice Roberts tells the story of the Regency period by studying the history of Cheltenham, Britains most Regency town. She attends a period society ball, investigates the rigid social hierarchy of the age and explores the Regency fondness for enemas. The penultimate episode of the series in which Alice Roberts studies one key period in history by delving into the secrets of a historic town that encapsulates the era, providing an accurate impression of what life was really like at key moments in the turbulent past

programme.title: Gangland Chronicles

programme.title: Secrets of the Hells Angels
programme.desc: The case of former massage parlour worker Margo Compton, who in 1977 was murdered alongside her six-year-old twin daughters in rural Oregon following her decision to testify in a state criminal prosecution that she was being pimped by Hells Angels. A detective later embarked on an 18-year quest to bring the killers to justice. Family members and eyewitnesses tell their stories for the first time

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The top 10 unexplained technologies, such as mysterious golden orbs discovered in Mexico, a sacred wooden box that could communicate with the heavens and an ancient tomb that is said to depict an astronaut. Might these sensational artifacts be evidence of otherworldly contact?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ten mysterious mountains that are notorious for otherworldly phenomena. They include a summit in Sri Lanka that is said to be a portal to other worlds and a volcano in Washington that was at the heart of a UFO sighting

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice Roberts tells the story of Viking England by studying the history of York. She takes part in a Viking battle, meets the metal detectorists behind one of the UKs greatest archaeological finds and gets her hands on an almost 1,000-year-old poo. Aerial archaeologist Ben Robinson takes to the skies to see how the current layout of York reflects its history

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explores the Norman period of British history by examining events that occurred in Winchester, a historic town that still retains many hallmarks of the 11th and 12th centuries. To get a taste of this era, she attempts to storm a castle wearing chain mail, investigates the origins of modern surgery, and tries some eel pie. At the conclusion of the episode, cutting edge CGI is used to take the town back in time, and recreate how it would have looked during this period of British history

programme.title: Combat Ships
programme.desc: The crucial role ships have played in international conflict over the past 500 years, beginning with the battleships declining influence during the 20th century

programme.title: Combat Ships
programme.desc: The story of the submarine and their role in naval warfare, from early beginnings in the American War of Independence to the modern day

programme.title: Combat Ships
programme.desc: A chronological appraisal of the dramatic D-Day story, focusing on the vessels that made the landings on the beaches of Normandy possible

programme.title: Combat Ships
programme.desc: A look at the silent threat of submarines, from tests in the River Thames, to the Germans deadly U-boat attacks in the Second World War

programme.title: Combat Ships
programme.desc: The role of ships during the Cold War, featuring a look at two submarines - former enemies - now moored in a Kent river. Plus, the story of Soviet submariner Vasili Arkhipov, who refused to authorise a nuclear launch

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.sub-title: East: Stone Age Engineering and Battle of Bullecourt
programme.desc: Alice Roberts investigates the best archaeological discoveries of 2018 from the East of the UK, including an ancient lost monument as old as Stonehenge uncovered in Suffolk, a dig at the site of Britains first tank battle, and a coin hoard that offers an insight into the effect the English civil war had on the lives of ordinary people

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts follows archaeologists as they unearth Britains most spectacular iron-age grave, a chariot burial in East Yorkshire. The programme also follows two other archaeological digs, an Iron-Age hill fort found in North Wales, and the remains of six roundhouses on the bed of Loch Tay in Perthshire, Scotland

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explores the UKs past through the stories of its towns, examining key periods in history by delving into the secrets of places that encapsulate them. In the first episode, Alice tells the story of Roman Britain by studying the history of Chester. She enjoys an authentic Roman feast, heads deep underground to check out an extraordinary archaeological find, and explores a radical theory regarding the Romans plans for Chester

programme.title: UFOs Declassified
programme.desc: Unsolved sightings of dark, triangular flying objects that occurred around the world during the 1980s and 90s in the UK, US and Belgium

programme.title: UFOs Declassified
programme.desc: An investigation into the Roswell incident in 1947, when a UFO landed in the New Mexico desert. At the time, the US army claimed it had recovered a flying saucer, but this was quickly retracted and the item was declared to be a humble weather balloon. Experts examine the evidence still available to try to reach a conclusive answer as to whether the crashed object was from Earth or another planet

programme.title: Combat Ships
programme.desc: An examination of objects found on the Mary Rose and what they reveal about life on a Tudor ship. Plus, the battle-winning tactics of Admiral Nelson on HMS Victory

programme.title: Combat Ships
programme.desc: A look at the tactics employed to pass strategically important ships under the nose of the enemy, and the use of intelligence to carry out naval attacks

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns

Aerial archaeologist Ben Robinson takes to the skies to see how the current layout reflects its history and, at the conclusion of the episode, cutting edge CGI is used to recreate how Norwich would have looked during this period of British history

programme.title: Clash of Ancient Warriors

programme.title: Clash of Ancient Warriors
programme.desc: The Battle of Marathon, which took place in 490 BC during the first Persian invasion of Greece. When the Persian army landed, it was met by the Athenian army

programme.desc: The unexpected things revealed by catastrophic disasters, featuring a medieval shipwreck that could reshape history and a Greek version of Atlantis that sank in a tsunami.

programme.desc: Why footprints discovered after a storm are altering English migration history by revealing evidence of early human activity that was previously hidden by the landscape. Plus, clues are unravelled to Maya political intrigue in Guatemala

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns

The penultimate episode of the series in which Alice Roberts studies one key period in history by delving into the secrets of a historic town that encapsulates the era, providing an accurate impression of what life was really like at key moments in the turbulent past

programme.desc: The team investigates a large, invisible bubble anomaly using drones, specifically within the Triangle area of the ranch. The analysis involves aerial experiments and the use of LiDAR scanning to map the phenomenon

The siblings reunion is explored, along with their confrontation with the strange occurrences that have haunted them

programme.title: Weird Britain
programme.desc: Andy McGrath returns to Cornwall, searching for legends. He meets a real-life mermaid, stalks a local churchyard for owl men and faeries, and stops off at a haunted smugglers inn to learn about its ghostly residents

programme.title: Weird Britain
programme.desc: Andy McGrath explores Devons pre-history in an ancient cavern, takes a crime-through-time tour of Dartmoors prison museum, and uncovers the terrifying legend behind Arthur Conan Doyles The Hound of the Baskervilles

programme.desc: Hugh Dennis and the team go on the hunt for the Morda Workhouse in Oswestry, Shropshire, and search for evidence of what life was really like for the poor who ended up there. As part of his investigation, Hugh also visits Llanfyllin Workhouse, where he takes some hard labour like the inmates would have done - stone breaking

programme.title: Bone Detectives: Britains Buried Secrets
programme.desc: Tori Herridge and a team of scientists attempt to piece together the lives behind discovered bones, and find out what happened to these people and how they died. This episode comes from Andover, Hampshire, where the construction of a proposed car park outside the city has been held up by the discovery of remains from over 100 young men. The bones are discovered to date back to Anglo-Saxon times, but appear to have been left in a mass grave rather than granted the Christian burial that was normal for their era

programme.title: Historys Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: Actor Laurence Fishburne explores Egypts 4,500 year-old Sphinx. This mighty, mythological creature - with the head of a human and the body of a lion - looks like its standing guard at the great pyramids of Giza. The episode delves into the Sphinxs origins, purpose, and potential hidden secrets, featuring insights from archaeologists and Egyptologists

programme.title: Forged in Fire

programme.title: Forged in Fire

programme.title: Kevin Costners The West
programme.desc: An epic journey through the birth of the American West, examining the relentless competition for land, power, and identity that forged a nations history, spanning a century of pivotal events. The host reflects on late 18th-century war leader Chief Little Turtles battle to resist American expansion into the Northwest Territory. This represented a struggle for sovereignty and survival for the Native American tribes during a time of great change. The stakes were high as Chief Little Turtle rallied his people, showcasing their bravery and determination

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explores the Second World War history of Dover, visiting an underground base beneath the famous white cliffs, from where the Dunkirk evacuation was masterminded. She also talks gets a first-hand account of the towns wartime history from a 90-year-old local and experiences what life was like for members of the Auxiliary Territorial Service during the Battle of Britain. Plus, aerial archaeologist Ben Robinson takes to the sky to survey the challenges faced by Royal Navy vessels deployed in the English Channel

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explores the Georgian era in her home city of Bristol. She takes a horse-drawn carriage ride to explore Cliftons Georgian architecture, samples some of the backstreet gin that was considered a threat to civilisation, and discovers the ingenious story behind the worlds first chocolate factory. She also delves into the citys links with the slave trade, uncovering horrific tales in the historical records. Plus, aerial archaeologist Ben Robinson provides a birds-eye view of how 18th-century wealth transformed the city

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explores Cardiffs Edwardian past, discovering how the coal industry transformed the Rhondda Valley in the early 1900s. She investigates the difficult and often dangerous work of the miners, and visits the trading floor where the first ever million pound cheque was signed. The programme also investigates how global shipping routes and plentiful employment brought immigrants from across the world to Wales, and meets descendants of people who came to the city in the early years of the 20th century

programme.title: Star Trek: Enterprise

programme.title: Star Trek: Enterprise

programme.title: Star Trek: Enterprise

programme.title: Star Trek: Enterprise

programme.title: Bone Detectives: Britains Buried Secrets
programme.desc: Tori Herridge and a team of scientists attempt to piece together the lives behind discovered bones, and find out what happened to these people and how they died. This episode comes from Andover, Hampshire, where the construction of a proposed car park outside the city has been held up by the discovery of remains from over 100 young men. The bones are discovered to date back to Anglo-Saxon times, but appear to have been left in a mass grave rather than granted the Christian burial that was normal for their era

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Kingdom of Plants
programme.desc: The naturalist and film-maker explores the many varieties of plant life housed at the Royal Botanic Gardens in Kew, west London, and explains what they reveal about the natural world and the development of life on Earth. He begins inside the establishments Palm House, whose climate has been engineered to simulate conditions found in rainforests, charting the evolution of plants that grow in the worlds wettest regions and investigating how flowering plants spread across the globe so rapidly

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Kingdom of Plants
programme.desc: The naturalist explores how the plants at Kew Gardens change through the seasons and demonstrates the surprising properties of several species, including the predatory pond-dwelling bladderwort utricularia and a fungus that appears to be capable of mind control. He also discusses the largest single organism on the planet, visits the worlds biggest flower and explains how plants and insects can communicate using scents and music

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Kingdom of Plants
programme.desc: The naturalist concludes his exploration of the Royal Botanic Gardens in Kew, west London, by examining plants that have evolved to minimise their dependence on water, enabling them to survive in the worlds driest environments. He witnesses a cactus blooming at midnight, tells the story of the spectacular flowering of the Agave franzosinii, and visits the Millennium Seed Bank, a facility designed to save plants from future extinction

programme.desc: Manchester United v Chelsea (Kick-off 5.30pm). Coverage of the Premier League match from Old Trafford. The visitors have won two of the last three meetings between the two teams, having not won any of the seven matches against the Red Devils before that. This fixture last year ended in a 1-1 draw as Moises Caicedo finish quickly cancelled out Bruno Fernandes second-half penalty

programme.title: Live: SNF
programme.desc: Fulham v Brentford (Kick-off 8.00pm). Coverage of the Premier League match from Craven Cottage, as the West London rivals go head to head for the first time this campaign. The hosts did the double over Brentford last season, as they came from behind in both meetings against the Bees. In this fixture last year Harry Wilson scored twice in stoppage time to earn the Cottagers a 2-1 victory after Vitaly Janelts 24th-minute opener

programme.title: Live LPGA Tour Golf
programme.sub-title: 2025 Walmart Nw Arkansas Championship Presented By PandG Day 2
programme.desc: The Walmart NW Arkansas Championship. Coverage of day two of the event at Pinnacle Country Club in Rogers, Arkansas. Jasmine Suwannapura was the victorious player last year, defeating American Lucy Li in a play-off to win her first title since 2019

programme.title: Live Formula 1
programme.desc: The Azerbaijan Grand Prix (Start-time 12.00pm). Coverage of the 17th round of the season from the Baku City Circuit. This is just the eighth edition of this race after its inception back in 2017, with Australias Daniel Ricciardo winning the first race eight years ago. Sergio Perez is the only driver to win this Grand Prix more than once thanks to victories in 2021 and 2023, with the likes of Lewis Hamilton, Max Verstappen and Valtteri Bottas all winning here as well

programme.title: Live Super Sunday
programme.desc: Sunderland v Aston Villa (Kick-off 2.00pm). Coverage of the Premier League match from Stadium of Light, as the two teams meet for the first time in seven years. Their last meeting back in March 2018 was in the Championship and saw Villa come away with a dominant 3-0 victory. The visitors have struggled so far this season by their standards, and only picked up one point from their first three league games before the international break

programme.title: Live Super Sunday
programme.desc: Arsenal v Manchester City (Kick-off 4.30pm). Coverage of the Premier League match from Emirates Stadium. The hosts have had the slight upper hand in recent fixtures between these two teams, winning two and drawing three of the last five meetings. The previous fixture between the two clubs saw the hosts dismantle Pep Guardiolas side, as the Gunners picked up a 5-1 victory at this venue last season, with five different players scoring for Mikel Artetas side

programme.title: Scealta na gCorn
programme.desc: Gráinne McElwain visits the rebel county of Cork, All Ireland winners in football, hurling and camogie across the decades. A county steeped in history, Gráinne is keen to find out about some of the silverware that honour patriots such as John Flyer Nyhan and his deep connection with the War of Independence and former Cork Lord Mayors Tomás Mac Curtain and Terence McSwiney. She also hears about the trophies named in honour of some of the countys influential women in football, such as Mary Quinn and a curiously named cup called Little Norah

programme.title: Worlds Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Another wild adventure from the hit series - this time sees long-term mates Joe Wilkinson and Zoe Lyons, whove travelled to gigs together for years, take on the wilds of eastern Turkey.

programme.title: Will and Ralf Should Know Better
programme.desc: Will Mellor and Ralf Little have been friends for over 20 years - the world has changed a lot since they first met and so have they. This documentary series sees them embark on a mission to discover what aspects of modern life they are getting right but more often are getting wrong. Travelling the length and breadth of the UK behind the wheel of an electric car, Will and Ralf laugh, cry and learn more about themselves and each other in a few weeks than they ever have in two decades of friendship. Along the way, they meet a series of extraordinary characters, explore unexpected worlds, and push themselves well out of their comfort zones. Whether trying to impress the World’s Strongest Woman with their strength, talking to nettles in an eco-village, living like Stone Age cavemen or stripping naked in front of 1,000 women, Will and Ralf challenge themselves and each other to learn new things and to push themselves to do and be better. Along the way, stuck in the car for hours with only a satnav and a bespoke playlist to distract them, they bond not just through reminiscing about the good old days and indulging in in-car karaoke, but also through talking about where they are now as middle-aged men and opening up to each other

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? At Christmas
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts a festive edition of the comedy panel show in which the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the Christmas fun are former Test Match Special commentator Henry Blofeld, Witless star Kerry Howard, broadcaster the Rev Richard Coles and BBC News presenter Clive Myrie. They all reveal amazing stories, but are they telling the truth, or making it all up?

programme.title: The Americas with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon travels across Central America, from the Caribbean to the Pacific. Along the way, he goes diving on a coral reef on the coast of Belize, and witnesses a gun battle between park rangers and intruders in Chiquibul National Park. He also discovers how climate change has left Guatemala devastated by famine and drought, reports on measures to curb gang violence in El Salvador, and learns how Costa Rica aims to become the worlds first carbon neutral country by 2021

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Charlotte buys an 18th-century portrait at auction, but on returning home is attacked by a robber, who steals the prestigious item. Looking out the window, she sees Lovejoys pick-up speeding away. When quizzed, the dealer finds the events of that night difficult to recall as he had been seriously inebriated. Ian McShane and Caroline Langrishe star

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A deranged murderer with a vendetta against Lovejoy kidnaps and threatens to kill Charlotte, trying to lure the antiques dealer into a trap via a series of fiendish puzzles. Christopher Fairbank (Moxey in Auf Wiedersehen, Pet) guest stars, with Ian McShane and Caroline Langrishe

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team is given the task of re-examining the unsolved case of peace protester Josh Livesey, found dead near a nuclear base in 1984. Other campaigners pleaded innocence at the time, but refused to co-operate with police, blaming the death on Secret Service skulduggery. Detective drama, starring Alun Armstrong, James Bolam, Amanda Redman and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A dying man asks the team to clear the name of his son, a talented junior golfer who committed suicide after being implicated in the murder of a 10-year-old boy. Aiding the investigation is a former chief superintendent who admits she always had doubts about the teenagers guilt, but the committee members of the exclusive golf club where the victims body was discovered prove reluctant to help the officers with their inquiries. Isla Blair and Cherie Lunghi guest star

programme.title: Signora Volpe
programme.desc: The return of the thriller series about a British spy-turned-detective who moves to Italy but is followed by trouble wherever she goes. programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Alzheimer sufferer Edward Alderston comes under suspicion of involvement when an ex-finance company high-flyer responsible for the loss of many elderly peoples life savings is found floating in a swimming pool with a samurai sword in his back

programme.title: The Count of Monte Cristo
programme.desc: Edmond reveals to Villefort that Heloise stole the vial of poison from him - the same poison used to murder the Marquise.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: Part one of two. Deed reluctantly helps Jo by examining why funding for legal aid was withdrawn in the case of a soldier who committed suicide after being damaged by army vaccines. However, he risks causing a constitutional crisis when he decides the only way to win justice for the deceaseds family is to accuse the original judge of bias

programme.desc: A school camp takes a deadly turn when a teacher is found swinging lifelessly from a zipline - apparently poisoned before the ride began. programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A witness gives Ben and Nate a lead after their patrol car is hit by a stray bullet, but no evidence can be found to identify the owner of a vehicle seen speeding from the scene. The investigation takes a sudden turn when forensics discover two bullet casings outside the home of their eyewitness. Meanwhile, morale is at a low ebb at Sun Hill over the lack of support offered to Callum over the recent accusations of assault

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jo and her team are summoned to the scene of a road traffic accident in which a teenager was hit by a car, but has since fled the scene. Instead, they end up dealing with another youngster found fatally wounded in a nearby park. Drugs are found under the crash vehicle, and a witness confirms the two youths were seen together in the park, but Max gets impatient as Jos investigation begins to flounder and Commander Kennedy has to rally the disheartened detectives

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Morale within the team picks up as the hunt for Paul Sorrels killer begins to make progress. The dead youngsters cousin reveals the lad was - uncharacteristically - involved in a drug deal to help his mother make ends meet, but the prime suspects are released because of a lack of evidence. Mickey is furious when Neil allows Max to approach his informant, knowing it could put her in danger

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Suspicion falls on the father of a four-year-old boy who goes missing from his garden, but CCTV footage of the abduction tells a different story. Callum, visiting Sun Hill to discuss his suspension, follows the unfolding case and cannot resist chipping in with his opinion of the suspect, but it is solid work by his colleagues in the uniform branch that finally tracks the missing child to a storm drain beside the Thames, where rapidly rising water puts several lives in danger. Joel Beckett guest stars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jack directs an operation to keep rival football fans apart, but ends up unwittingly channelling a group of them into a dangerous situation. As tension mounts, Commander Lisa Kennedy becomes increasingly anxious about her son, who is attending the match, and she takes control when an ambulance is needed to reach a woman suffering an asthma attack in the crowd. In the ensuing clean-up, a body is discovered

programme.title: Home Fires
programme.desc: Drama about the lives of a group of Womens Institute members in a rural Cheshire community during the Second World War. In the face of an impending conflict with Germany, the Great Paxford WI faces a difficult decision. When president Joyce Cameron resigns, taking most of the membership with her, Frances Barden and her supporters must recruit new helpers from unexpected places. Starring Samantha Bond, Francesca Annis, Ruth Gemmell, Claire Rushbrook and Frances Grey, with Ed Stoppard and Mark Bazeley

programme.title: Home Fires
programme.desc: As Frances and Joyce battle for leadership of the new group, the others face problems of a much more personal nature. Erica and Wills relationship is tested after his cancer diagnosis, Pat is struggling with her unhappy marriage and Miriam has one last chance to stop David enlisting. Newcomer Teresa Fenchurch gets off to a bad start, but her mishap brings a dashing RAF officer to the village. Francesca Annis and Samantha Bond star, with Frances Grey, Ed Stoppard, Claire Rushbrook and Leanne Best

programme.title: Home Fires
programme.desc: The impact of the war begins to be felt in Great Paxford as the women are forced to make sacrifices for the salvage effort. But soon matters on the personal front replace their efforts on the home front as Kate and Jacks relationship intensifies, Pats marriage deteriorates and Claire finally plucks up the courage to ask Spencer out - unaware he is hiding a secret that could ruin their relationship before it has even started. Meanwhile, Alison resorts to desperate measures to pay a bill, and soon realises her actions will cost her much more. Wartime drama, with Claire Rushbrook, Daisy Badger, Rachel Hurd-Wood and Fenella Woolgar

programme.title: Catherine Cooksons The Man Who Cried
programme.desc: Feature-length period drama about Abel Mason, an ordinary working man whose extramarital affair leads to murder, and prompts him to hit the road with his son in search of a new life. The pair head north and Abel eventually finds employment with a wealthy garage owner. Ciaran Hinds and Kate Buffery star

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Everyone is looking forward to Trixie and Matthews wedding and a bonny baby competition brings the community together. Its not all good news, however, as the team learn about a pregnant woman and her family living in a cramped caravan, while a worrying disease outbreak directly impacts the residents of Nonnatus House

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: Supermodel sensation Birdie reluctantly returns to her roots in Great Slaughter at the insistence of her money-obsessed manager, Max Savage. When he is found dead in a locked room, Sister Boniface and the team are called in to investigate

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.sub-title: And Then I Fell in Love
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Nikki sees a barefoot girl being knocked over by a car, marking the beginning of a case that takes the team into the harrowing world of sex grooming and teenage prostitution. The police know the girl has been abused and suspicion soon falls on her stepfather. Meanwhile, an early-morning bath saves Harrys life, and two puzzling corpses are brought in to the centre - a heavily tattooed man and a decomposed body found at the airport. Guest starring Sanjeev Bhaskar, Elyes Gabel and Madeline Duggan

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The penultimate episode sees the retired detectives investigating possibly their most difficult cold case yet. A bloodstained bust is uncovered during construction work in a cemetery and the evidence points to the murder of an alternative-medicine practitioner seven years earlier. Further clues lead to the controversial world of cryopreservation - the practice of keeping clinically dead patients frozen to extend their life cycle. Sasha is determined they dont put a foot wrong - but with the sobering possibility that two perpetrators are still at large, the detectives are forced to go out on a limb

programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.desc: Comedy drama series from A Touch of Frost writer Richard Harris. Detective Constable Dangerous Davies is an obstinate traditionalist used to being given bottom-of-the-pile jobs at his north London station until a routine inquiry offers him a lead in a 20-year-old unsolved murder case. Enlisting the help of his eccentric drinking buddy Mod Lewis, the mild-mannered detective sets out to prove himself to his colleagues. Peter Davison and Sean Hughes star

programme.title: Hamish Macbeth

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Emma is feeling raw after her marital difficulties boiled over into violence and shows her tough side to new recruit Beth Green (former EastEnder Louisa Lytton) as they investigate a womans claim her baby has been stolen. Jack is anxious to prove hes a worthy DCI and agrees to go undercover with Sam to get a lead on the illegal baby-selling business, but his mistake puts the DI in danger

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Will and Nikki investigate the suspicious death of a child protection officer on the Cheetham estate. New recruit Beth delivers her first caution following an affray between a car salesman and a woman protesting against the dangers of 4x4 vehicles, but theres more to the conflict than first meets the eye. Boothby Graffoe guest stars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Nikki coaxes a potential suicide down from a factory building and urges him to give information on the child pornography ring he has been invited to join. Reg and Phil are called to a funeral home where a valuable necklace has been taken from a corpse in a sealed coffin. Siobhan Redmond guest stars as Scene of Crime Officer Lorna Hart

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Phils spell in uniform comes to a triumphant end when he borrows a bike to chase a mugger and recovers £15,000 in cash. The case gets more interesting when the victim admits hes being blackmailed. Heaton reassures terrified prosecution witness Martin Turnbull he will be given protection following threats from Ray Moore, only to discover the villainous ex-cop has subtler ways of intimidating people

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.desc: Advanced care paramedics Ben and Rachel respond to a suspected heroin overdose. An elderly woman needs assistance after suffering a fall at home

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: The Queensland Ambulance Service respond to a motorbike crash. The patient is in good spirits despite suffering a serious injury to his left leg

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Pete meets a puppy who needs urgent treatment for a badly broken leg and a young Doberman who has spent most of her life in quarantine kennels

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Pete travels to Northern Ireland to pick up three stray dogs and bring them back to Essex. He also meets a Shar Pei who is in constant pain and may need surgery

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: In a One Born Every Minute special, cameras follow four couples through their multiple pregnancies and births. Ana and Paul are thrilled at the prospect of becoming first-time parents to triplets, but receive worrying news at a routine scan, while Beth has to have emergency laser surgery in her womb after her babies are diagnosed with twin-to-twin transfusion syndrome. Carolyne and Gordon, already parents to four children, are shocked to discover they can expect three more, while Sophie and Carlos try to cope with the premature arrival of their two daughters

programme.title: One Born: What Happened Next?
programme.desc: Three couples who have featured on the programme share their experiences of parenthood 12 months after they originally took part. A woman explains why it will not be easy for her partner to cope with looking after their child when she returns to work, and another couple voice their concerns about the effect that starting a family has had on their health. Meanwhile, Lucy seeks her husbands approval as she decides to resume her career as an opera singer

programme.title: Nurses on the Ward
programme.desc: At Queen Alexandra Hospital in Portsmouth, an engaging, funny and dedicated team of nurses reveal the realities of life on the ward. Paediatric nurse Mahbuba treats a girl with a brain tumour

programme.title: Nurses on the Ward
programme.desc: Paediatric nurse Mahbuba deals with a baby who cant breathe, while Rebecca treats a deaf cardiac patient and military nurse Scott cares for a struggling asthmatic

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: Ten aspiring designers compete in a commercial design challenge to redesign Oxfordshire show homes, with judge Michelle Ogundehin assessing their efforts with the help of guest Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr set about renovating the bathrooms. Amanda is unconvinced about Alans bidet and Alan tries to veto Amandas disco ball installation - but neither will back down on their vision. In Alans quest to stay true to Sicilian culture, he treats Amanda to a visit to Marsalas salt pans for a unique spa experience. Amandas dreams of a roll-top bath come crashing down as Alan sets her the task of recycling the apartments existing one, but karma kicks in as his DIY skills are pushed to the limit with a masterclass in floor tiling

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The award-winning documentary series moves to Birmingham Womens Hospital. Twenty-five-year-old Samantha and her partner Tony, who struggled for years to conceive, return to the ward after losing their first child at 25 weeks. However, Samanthas medical history means the birth is not without challenges. Meanwhile, 33-year-old Sharon and 44-year-old Rav come to the hospital expecting their second child together, and Rhiana and her partner Lee hope for another textbook water birth for the arrival of their second son

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Parents-to-be include 29-year-old Ben, who has been experiencing sympathy pains and cravings, and thinks he needs to man-up for his partner Amy. Ambitious young doctors Nikoletta and Andreas were concentrating on their careers when a chance meeting evolved into a whirlwind, long-distance romance, and Andreas is determined to be at Nikolettas side as a father and not as a doctor, putting his medical training to one side

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Ashley, whos 35, is determined to right the wrongs he faced in his own childhood with a family of his own. He and his 30-year-old partner Gemma are expecting their fourth child together. Meanwhile, 41-year-old Sunny and 32-year-old Shay, who met on the set of a Bollywood film, arrive in the ward expecting their first child

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Beth and David, who met online on a Harry Potter website, arrive in the hospital awaiting the birth of their baby daughter. Meanwhile, 28-year-old Kathereen from Colombia and Birmingham-born Nick, whos 40, are in the maternity ward expecting their second child together, and couple Gavin and Carla arrive for the birth of their baby son

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Sharnee, whos 25, and 27-year-old Dan await the arrival of their first child together. Meanwhile, after seven years trying and two failed rounds of IVF, 33-year-old Jo and 47-year-old Pat arrive on the ward to be induced, and April, whos 27, is having her third baby, with support from her little sister Chloe

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Chantell, whos 34, and 33-year-old Phil arrive in the hospital awaiting the birth of their third child together. Chantell had a troubled upbringing and never thought she would find love or have a family of her own, but when she met Phil, everything changed. Meanwhile, young couple Emily and Nathan, who still live at home, are determined to show the world that they can embrace the responsibilities of parenthood as they welcome their baby boy. Elsewhere, Clarke and Debbie, who have had a difficult pregnancy, arrive in the maternity ward

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Sarah, whos 40, and 29-year-old Tom, await the birth of their second child together. Sarah has a close relationship with her family, and hopes to have the same close bond with her daughter when she comes along. Meanwhile, couple Dawn and Scott arrive expecting baby number eight, and 27-year-old Jess and her partner Leon also arrive on the ward

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Paramedics need to get a sick baby to hospital. They also treat a man who suffers from epilepsy and an elderly lady who needs to take her medication

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Following crews from West Midlands Ambulance Service during the festive period. Laura and Anna are called to a man who has fallen off a roof, hitting his head on the way down

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Heavy snow in the West Midlands causes problems and two separate crews treat patients, both called John, who have both broken their hips after falling

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: A four-year-old girl has her droopy eyelid lifted, a rugby player gets his broken nose reset and a woman has an operation on her wrist after almost a year of agony

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: Nick has an ultrasound taken from inside his body to find out if he needs open-heart surgery, and Irene has gel removed from her eye to make her see again

programme.title: Nurses on the Ward
programme.desc: Renal nurse Neil treats a 19-year-old whose kidney transplant is failing, and on the surgical ward, Kat cares for a man recovering from a bowel cancer operation

programme.title: Nurses on the Ward
programme.desc: One of Advanced Nurse Practitioner Carolines patients is deteriorating rapidly and she must make a very difficult call to his wife to explain the perilous situation

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: Michelle Ogundehin splits the contestants into three teams, each of which is given an open-plan office space to transform for a technology client, a sustainable beauty brand and a media team. The brief is to create a work space, a break-out space and a meeting space within the office, and Michelle will be looking for both displays of signature style and work that suits the needs of the client

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Alan takes charge designing the first bedroom, but doubt soon sets in as Amanda and Scott struggle to get on board with his artistic vision. To nail his rustic chic look, Alan visits interior designer Marie at her 300-year-old palazzo and ropes in Amanda to help source vintage gems at Palermos famous flea market. Later, Amanda surprises Alan with a birthday boat trip along Sicilys stunning Zingaro coast

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his travels through the capital in the heart of Londons East End. First, Michael explores Hackney Wick, where he hears about The Daily Worker newspapers origins, before heading to Londons West End to hunt down Londons oldest surviving Indian restaurant, Veeraswamy. Here, he tries his hand at making chapatis, under the watchful eye of the restaurants master chef

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his travels through London in Hampstead, where he learns more about the founder of psychoanalysis, Sigmund Freud, who fled the Austrian capital of Vienna during the Second World War and made his way London. Then, Michael pays a visit to the famous Abbey Road Studios, before making his way to Finsbury and touring the innovative and sculptural housing development, Bevin Court

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael tracks the River Thames from east to west. Starting in Dagenham, he finishes this leg of his tour at one of Londons most iconic buildings, Battersea Power Station, built during the 1930s by Giles Gilbert Scott

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

David Renwicks award-winning comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave

programme.desc: Victor takes up life drawing classes and Margaret is only too happy to see the back of him - until she learns the subject is a nude woman whom he has volunteered to drive home. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Industrial Age
programme.desc: The former steeplejack sets out on an enthusiastic tour of Britains industrial heritage, exploring the early use of wind and water power and visiting some steam engines still in use today. On his travels Fred meets a man who has built a windmill in his back garden and hunts for examples of early beam engines that are still functioning today

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Industrial Age
programme.desc: An exploration of the textile mills and factories that once thrived in Britain during the Industrial Revolution. From New Lanark in Scotland to the mill town of Burnley, Fred meets ex-workers to discover what life was really like, and chats to a group that has dedicated 30 years to restoring mill engines

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Industrial Age
programme.desc: The former steeplejack examines the history of the iron and steel industries, beginning with a visit to Ironbridge Gorge in Shropshire. Fred moves on to the Black Country, where he learns how the anchor for the ill-fated Titanic was made, before getting the chance to drive the biggest steam-powered rolling mill engine he has ever seen

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Industrial Age
programme.desc: A tour of Britains mining heritage takes Fred from Cornwall to Scotland, where he visits sites of lead, slate, tin and coal extraction. programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on another journey around the country to discover how the railways have affected people and communities, and the legacy they left. The first leg of a journey through north-west England begins in Carlisle, where investigates the Victorian appetite for the custard cream, before braving a perilous descent into the only operational slate mine in England and discovering a miniature railway

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey through the Lake District, where he discovers a magical world of talking rabbits, ducks, hedgehogs and mice, who have entertained children for more than 100 years. At the village home of author and illustrator Beatrix Potter, he learns about her legacy and her fears about the railways. Michael presses on to Brantwood, home of the Victorian art critic, John Ruskin, and finishes with a brief encounter at Carnforth

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reads the riot act in Preston, and discovers four mill workers were shot dead at a protest in 1842. In Darwen, he traces developments in interior design from wallpaper to paint, before exploring the Victorian industrial landscape of Salford in the paintings on LS Lowry. He finishes his leg of the journey on Kersal Moor, where he discovers the poetry of Edwin Waugh and twists his tongue around the Lancashire dialect

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from St Helens to Knutsford, finding out about modern glass-making and how techniques invented in the Victorian era to construct buildings such as the Crystal Palace have evolved and are powering a new architectural revolution

programme.title: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: Footage of marine life in different environments around the north, beginning with a tropical coral reef which has medicinal properties for dolphins, and is used as a tool by tusk fish. In Japan, a shipwreck is home to the Asian sheephead wrasse, which can change gender, while in the polar north, walruses struggle to find ice floes for their pups to rest on as climate change takes its toll on the environment

programme.title: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: Creatures that live in volcanic hot spots on the ocean bed, areas that reach temperatures hot enough to melt lead and which may hold the secrets behind all life on Earth. Other strange creatures from the depths of the sea include bone-eating worms, fish that walk rather than swim, and hordes of squid. Plus, footage of sharks in a feeding frenzy over the dead body of a whale and the wildlife of the Midnight Zone in the Pacific, an area that never receives any natural light, forcing creatures to rely on their own bioluminescence

programme.title: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: Creatures that live on coral reefs, including groupers, small predators that scientists believe are as intelligent as chimpanzees. These creatures have a remarkable aptitude for communication to the point where they can interact with other species including octopi and work together to catch prey. Plus, footage of a vast spawning event involving several different species of fish, coral and invertebrates, and time-lapse photography of coral polyps growing and dying, creating a structure visible from space

programme.title: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: Wildlife that live thousands of kilometres from land, featuring footage of baby turtles using debris as life rafts and whales sharks embarking on lengthy voyages across the Pacific to the point where it is safest to give birth. Special pressure-proof cameras are used to film sperm whales hunting for squid a kilometre beneath the surface and the impact of plastic pollution on the oceans is revealed

programme.title: Wilderness with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon travels across the Kalahari desert in southern Africa, one of the continents last great unspoilt wildernesses. He begins his journey in a small village in Namibias Nyae Nyae conservancy, where he sets out on a hunt for wildebeest with San trackers, who still live in the traditional way. After weeks of dusty travel, Simon ends his journey in the Okavango Delta, where seasonal rains turn the desert in to a vast oasis of greenery

programme.title: Vera

A faded tattoo identifies the victim as Jack Reeves, a young man from the local travelling community, but what is his connection to the immigrants? As the case unfolds, Vera and her team must connect the dots between Jack and a wounded Serbian, and expose the tragic truth at the heart of Pryor Farm. With Mark Bonnar, Mark Womack and Jim Sturgeon

programme.title: Sport Stories: Philly McMahon
programme.desc: The eight-time All-Ireland-winner talks about his journey of self-sacrifice, sense of identity, personal tragedy and an insatiable desire for success

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: The spinning-chair singing contest has new coaches as Jennifer Hudson - the US singer and actress who rose to fame on American Idol - and Gavin Rossdale, singer and guitarist with rock band Bush - join old hands Will.i.am and Tom Jones. As usual, things kick off with the blind auditions, in which the coaches sit with their backs to the would-be singing stars, selecting the ones they like by vocal ability alone. Hosted by Emma Willis

programme.title: Dont Look Back in Anger
programme.desc: Archive news documentary looking back at the headline stories of the past 20 years, focusing this week on 2010

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Amy Childs tries to hide her identity as she hosts a dinner party for four guests who will win a cash prize if they can guess who their mystery cook is - and leave the former TOWIE star to do the washing up. Presented by Brian McFadden

programme.title: Bling
programme.desc: Mr Freeze gets revved up over a pair of vintage watches, and Tracy finds herself swayed by a little ruby and diamond number. Meanwhile, Helen entices a fellow gemologist with some bespoke pieces, and David is worried he may not be able to fix an unusual ring

programme.title: Storage Hoarders
programme.desc: Aggie MacKenzie helps a man whose mansion is full owing to his passion for collecting, and encounters another who hoards spare items, in case he needs them in the future

programme.title: The Real Marigold Hotel
programme.desc: Saying goodbye to Puducherry, the celebrities journey north to the foothills of the Himalayas for their final week in India. Following a treacherous drive up narrow, winding roads, they arrive at their new home on the outskirts of Rishikesh, ready to experience the spiritual side of life in Northern India. After starting the next day with an outdoor group meditation session among the wild monkeys and spectacular views, Duncan and John waste no time exploring the bustling town of Rishikesh, which attracts thousands of pilgrims from all over the world

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills
programme.sub-title: We Need To Talk About Kathy
programme.desc: When Kathy skips the flight home from Aspen, whispers surface about a meltdown directed at Kyle from the night before. Back in Beverly Hills, Erika tells Dorit that shes hurt that Garcelle talked behind her back - and vows to say it to her face. Sutton and the others later don flapper dresses for Crystals swank Roaring Twenties birthday party, but one arrival spoils the event

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills
programme.desc: Erika throws a pop-up product launch, Dorit and Crystal question old friendships, and Erika and Sutton build a new connection over fancy bubbles and casual biscuits. Meanwhile, Kathy meets with Kyle to apologise and move forward, but Lisas arrival threatens the womens bonds

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: LA

Pushed to breaking point, he finds an unexpected source of support in his estranged wife, who leaves him determined to take an active role in the case - starting by finding out more about those in the government who work closely with Julia

programme.desc: The actor presents the first of two programmes documenting life for many of the millions who live, work and have families in North Korea. Michaels arrival coincides with the historic meeting between North Korean leader Kim Jong-Un and South Korean president Moon Jae-In, as he embarks on a journey of some 1,300 miles of the reclusive nation south to north, visiting sites and locations rarely explored by Westerners, determined to spend time with everyday Korean citizens from all walks of life

programme.desc: Terminal 3 re-opens its doors to the public 15 months into the global pandemic, with 11 Virgin flights set to take off, but teething problems threaten to delay one of the departures. Its business as usual in Terminal 5 as Passenger Experience Manager Tas is called to deal with an arriving passenger who is refusing to pay for his mandatory Covid tests, while the City of London Corporations Animal Reception Centre have quarantined two dogs who have flown into the USA without proof of treatment for tapeworm

programme.title: Heathrow: Britains Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Passenger experience manager Numan is back after a year on furlough and faced with a terminal of 24 passengers who are missing 50 pieces of luggage. Out on the airfield, Inspector Shard and Sergeant Dawson receive word of a man who is wandering around on the apron, sparking a cross-terminal manhunt

Husband-and-wife team Richard and Lorna then face the Limitless Ladder looking to win some major money - theyve been doing some proper homework, but can they translate it into hard cash?

programme.desc: The duo meet two engineering brothers who have built a fleet of giant robots and road trip to Osaka where they explore the area in go-karts. Ben Shephard gives the celebrities a chance to claim up to £20,000 for their charity of choice by dropping tokens down four chutes, in the hope of knocking piles off a moving shelf. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.desc: The documentary going behind the scenes of the London airport returns for a fifth season. For the first time this series, viewers will also see the work of the Border Forces canine drugs detection team - Rachel and her dog Cole, who in his career has intercepted more than £1million worth of class-A contraband. Narrated by Julie Walters

programme.title: Heathrow: Britains Busiest Airport

programme.title: Danny Dyer: How to Be a Man
programme.desc: Danny looks at what the future for men might look like. He meets stay-at-home dads in Newcastle, a sex therapist in Brighton, and goes alternative shopping with young DJ Woody Cook. He meets with psychologists at Sunderland University to try to understand the male mental health crisis, before observing a very different approach to therapy for men. Dannys journey ends with an emotional day at a Jungian male retreat, where like-minded men are trying to figure out how men can evolve their masculinity, rather than abandon it, in the search for a happy future for men

programme.title: Ridley
programme.desc: The tranquillity of the serene village of Colden Vale is shattered when beloved wife and mother Tara Dunning mysteriously vanishes, with initial speculations lingering on the possibility she might have intentionally disappeared. However, a chilling discovery alters the course of the inquiry and suggests more sinister motivations and the stakes are raised after a second person goes missing and is found dead shortly afterwards

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An ex-soldier visits Aidensfield on holiday and his daughter strikes up a relationship with a local farm hand. Greengrass finds himself the owner of stolen cigarettes and Jo receives tragic news. Rural drama, with Bill Maynard and Nick Berry

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick helps a woman claiming she is being harassed by a mysterious stalker, and discovers the culprit is closer to home than anticipated. programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Jo is concerned that her father is not managing without his wife and emotions boil over after a car accident. Meanwhile, Greengrasss brother arrives in the village

programme.desc: The master of Gresham College, amateur astronomer Andrew Crompton, is found dead at the Oxford University observatory, and Lewis finds there are numerous suspects, from senior academics to college scouts. Laura Hobsons involvement with a local orchestra helps her give the detective inside information on the complex relationships within the close-knit community, and Hathaways sharp mind cracks an astronomical conundrum as the team slowly unravels the riddle of the victims death. Guest starring Sophie Ward (Heartbeat), Diana Quick (Brideshead Revisited) and Robert Hardy (Cornelius Fudge in the Harry Potter films)

David Suchet stars, with Jenny Agutter, Tim Piggot-Smith and Celia Imrie

programme.title: Save Money: My Beautiful Green Home
programme.desc: Ranvir Singh and Kunle Barker travel to Tamworth to meet Keira and Ewan in their newly purchased 1960s home. With a tiny budget they have allocated £3,000 to renovate their bathroom, yet they want a luxury hotel look. Their green makeover involves replacing a water-guzzling toilet and bath with money- and energy-saving fittings as well as creating a chic and contemporary finish. For inspiration, Ranvir heads to a house with a wood-fired hot tub

programme.title: Wild Tokyo
programme.desc: Documentary revealing surprising stories of human-animal cohabitation in Japans capital, one of the worlds busiest cities

programme.title: An Audience with Shirley Bassey
programme.desc: The Welsh superstar delivers rousing renditions of her well-known songs, including Big Spender, Goldfinger and This is My Life

programme.title: Paul OGradys Animal Orphans
programme.desc: The comedian begins another tour of Zambia, Namibia and South Africa helping to hand-rear orphaned animals and prepare them for release back into their natural habitats. His first stop is the Moholoholo Wildlife Rehabilitation Centre, where he meets an eight-month-old rhino which lost its mother when she was killed by poachers. Next, he teaches a young aardvark how to hunt for termites, before providing some much-needed company for a lion cub which was raised as a pet until she got too big to handle

programme.title: After the Flood
programme.desc: When the town of Waterside is hit with the largest flood in its history, its people pull together to keep everyone safe. Jos actions bring an unwelcome visitor into the community who threatens to expose her secret investigation. Drama, starring Sophie Rundle

programme.title: 15 Days
programme.desc: A shot rings out in an isolated farmhouse as a young man is killed by an unseen hand. Two weeks previously, four siblings return home to scatter their mothers ashes and read her will, little realising that this family reunion will end in murder. Thriller, starring Catherine Tyldesley, David Caves and Mali Jones

programme.title: Come Rain, Come Shine
programme.desc: Come Rain, Come Shine is a drama, centering on working-class ex-docker Don (Sir David Jason, A Touch of Frost). Family means everything to Don and he is fiercely proud of his wealthy son David, a property developer, whose flashy lifestyle is in sharp contrast to his parents simple and unpretentious life. When the economic crunch hits, the truth about Davids affluent life surfaces and facing financial ruin he moves back home. Don is determined to keep his family afloat, emotionally and financially, and in the process they all discover what is truly important to them in life.

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: When a young woman is shot dead at a bonfire night celebration, the police immediately arrest an aboriginal boy who was standing near her with a gun in his hand. However, Blake realises the murder is not that simple and is forced to challenge the racist bias of both the police and the whole town. Starring Craig McLachlan

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.title: Heartbeat

Meanwhile, Greengrass acquires a metal detector and thinks he has struck gold - but someone else gets to it first. Nick Berry and Bill Maynard star

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Hathaway and Lewis investigate a murder committed on the first night of a quiz weekend held at Chaucer College. Sealing the college grounds to interrogate the remaining 11 contestants, the pair discover the victim had a track record for sexual harassment involving fellow competitors, as well as past dealings with a shady engineering business funded by Russian gangsters and masterminded by Oxford professor Charles Milner - another quiz fan. With guest stars Alan Davies (QI), Timothy West (Bleak House) and Nicholas Farrell (The Iron Lady)
