programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.desc: A cleaner is found dead in her home and suspicion immediately falls upon her lodger, who is arrested and convicted of her murder. It appears to be an open-and-shut case, but Superintendent Spence begins to question the mans guilt and invites Poirot to help uncover the identity of the real killer. The Belgian sleuth teams up with crime writer Ariadne Oliver (My Familys Zoe Wanamaker) as he tries to crack the case. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Richard Hope, Joe Absolom, Amanda Root, Sian Phillips and Raquel Cassidy

programme.title: Marcus Wareings Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: Marcus explores new possibilities on his Sussex smallholding, having noticed more and more deer appearing on his land. He heads off to the Knepp Estate to meet Charlie and Issy, who have turned over their 3,500-acre farm to rewilding, in which deer play a vital role. Back at the farm, Marcus has invited two apprentice chefs to have a foraging masterclass from expert and friend, Colin Wheeler. When it comes to foraging, Marcus is an apprentice too, so along with the young chefs, hes excited to learn what edible plants he has growing unnoticed on his property

programme.title: Save Money: My Beautiful Green Home
programme.desc: Ranvir Singh and Kunle Barker meet eco-enthusiasts Rachel and Jake in Cambridgeshire. They are 10 months into transforming their 1960s three-bedroom house into an energy-efficient sustainable eco-home. With the majority of the green build done, Kunle offers up his design experience to tackle their open-plan kitchen and living room, which theyve ambitiously moved up to the first floor to maximise spectacular views and to harness the solar power of the sun. For eco inspiration, Ranvir heads to Greenend House, an underground house in Buckinghamshire

programme.title: How to Lose Weight Well
programme.sub-title: From the Coffee to the Korean K-Pop Diet
programme.desc: Part two of two. Dr Javid Abdelmoneim reports on how the diet industry has adopted technology and takes a gym bike for a spin, as six more volunteers put the most popular diets to the test. Old friends Heena and Dhruti take on the coffee and chocolate diets, father and son Joe and Jad try the Mexican and K-pop diet diets, while Joan and Rosie get to grips with the macro diet and a smart app diet

programme.title: Hairy Bikers: Route 66
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King mount their bikes for the final leg of their epic journey along the American road. They begin in Las Vegas, where they learn how to make apparently the best mashed potato in the world - inspiring them to cook a massive lobster and prawn cocktail. Back on the road they finally reach California, where they follow the path of the 49ers during the gold rush and learn about cooking with marijuana - which is perfectly legal in Los Angeles. They also enjoy the best tacos they have ever eaten at a taco festival, before reaching Santa Monica pier - the end of their trip

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.sub-title: A Year on My Planet Earth
programme.desc: The stories of the scientists and conservationists who used pioneering techniques to uncover new behaviour, enabling the film-makers to producer this extraordinary series

programme.title: The Widower
programme.desc: Malcolms financial problems begin to mount, leaving him under pressure and running out of ideas. He decides he would be better off with Felicity dead and plans another fatal car crash so he and their son can start afresh, funded by her life insurance policy. Felicitys suspicious father Brian and sister Jane force Malcolms briefcase open, and unearth his grisly plot - but must act quickly to prevent it being executed. Fact-based drama, starring Reece Shearsmith, Kate Fleetwood, James Laurenson and John Hannah

programme.title: Mum
programme.desc: Cathy is having a barbecue and wants to know why Michael has not replied to her email. Comedy, starring Lesley Manville, Peter Mullan and Lisa McGrillis

programme.title: Mum
programme.desc: Kelly and Jason are up early and going on holiday. Meanwhile, Michael has had a terrible night and has something he wants to tell Cathy. Comedy, starring Lesley Manville, Peter Mullan and Lisa McGrillis

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: Ross is given hope for the Despards return to Honduras, but finds his new arch enemy Ralph Hanson has returned to Truro. Dwight gains unexpected patients, though his absences from home have unforeseen consequences, and Morwenna starts to slip away from the village in secret. Ralph enlists Tess and disgruntled locals to set a plot in motion to undo the Despards and the Poldarks

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: When a communist student is found dead after a run-in with local workers, Blake sifts through the politics and intrigue to find the killer. Crime drama, starring Craig McLachlan

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Anthea Turner plays mystery host as she throws a dinner party for four strangers at her home. All they have to do is guess who has been cooking for them to win a cash prize and leave the TV presenter doing his own washing up. But if she manages to keep her identity intact, theyll be the ones pulling on the Marigolds. Presented by Brian McFadden

programme.title: Paddington Station 24/7
programme.desc: Sundays services grind to a halt when the 11.57 service to Penzance derails as it is departing, while a knife-carrying passenger causes concern in Bristol. Elsewhere, a team of specialists clean the mats laid down to protect the tracks from the actions of passengers ignoring the signs advising them not to flush onboard toilets while the trains are in the station

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase Australia
programme.desc: Andrew OKeefe presents the Down Under version of the quiz show in which four people must work together to beat the Chaser and win a cash prize

programme.desc: Andrew OKeefe presents the Down Under version of the quiz show in which four people must work together to beat the Chaser and win a cash prize

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Magazine Show
programme.desc: All the latest from the world of the UEFA Champions League, featuring highlights and interviews

programme.title: Britains Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win a cash prize of £250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and Bruno Tonioli return to the judging panel with special guest judge KSI

programme.title: The Mike Tomlin Show
programme.desc: Sports show, with Pittsburgh Steelers head coach Mike Tomlin. The host offers insider insights, game previews, and candid commentary

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants Graham, Julie, Cheryl and Khush vie to find the single unbeatable answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Think Tank
programme.desc: Bill Turnbull hosts as three more contestants compete to win a cash prize, aided or hindered by the answers of the cast of contributors known as the Think Tank

programme.title: Storage Hoarders
programme.desc: Aggie MacKenzie comes to the aid of Graham, whose two clutter-filled garages are bursting at the seams, She also visits doctors receptionist Lynn, aiming to cure her of a hoarding obsession and give her home a clean bill of health

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Singer Jay Aston, best known as one quarter of 1981 Eurovision- winners Bucks Fizz, is todays VIP cook, providing a selection of dishes for a team of fitness fanatics who have to guess her identity. If the guests are successful, they will be one step closer to winning the full cash prize - but if they fail, they will be the ones doing the washing up. Hosted by Brian McFadden

programme.title: Dress to Impress
programme.desc: Business manager Kieran from Wiltshire puts his faith in the fashion choices of Harry, Aaron and Connor, who have to pick an outfit for him

programme.title: MandS: Dress the Nation
programme.desc: AJ Odudu and Vernon Kay host as nine amateur designers go head to head in a competition to win a dream job as a fashion designer for high street giant MandS. The designers are thrown in at the deep end as they are tasked with creating womenswear to be judged by guest expert Jade Jagger, Director of Womenswear at MandS Maddy Evans and store customers

programme.title: Hells Kitchen
programme.desc: The chefs must model their expertise and work in harmony to balance an array of ingredients and create a dish that really sings.

programme.title: Tell Me Everything
programme.desc: Coming-of-age drama. Jonny has moved to a new town, made a fresh start at a new college and has a whole new group of friends, but will they help him attract the attention of fellow new student Bex? Meanwhile, Naisha is cramping best friend Dylans style and Ella is devastated when an exposing video goes viral

programme.title: Gogglebox Ireland
programme.desc: Irelands most opinionated and entertaining TV viewers offer their opinions on some of the most memorable TV screened during the past week from the comfort of their own homes

programme.title: Autopsy USA
programme.desc: The death of singer and actress Debbie Reynolds, which occured the day after that of her daughter Carrie Fisher

programme.title: Inside China: The Battle for Tibet
programme.desc: Investigating the mystery of a missing boy, the 11th Panchen Lama, who was abducted by Beijing 30 years ago whose role now holds the key to the Dalai Lamas successor and to Tibets future. Using ground-breaking footage, testimony and interviews with recent Tibetan escapees, this documentary reveals the restrictions Tibetans face daily under Chinese President Xi Jinpings rule and sees how the unique culture of seven million Tibetans is being wiped away

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Louie Spence plays mystery host as he throws a dinner party for four strangers at his home. All they have to do is guess who has been cooking for them to win a cash prize and leave the dancer doing his own washing up. But if he manages to keep his identity intact, theyll be the ones pulling on the Marigolds. Presented by Brian McFadden

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Towie star James `Arg" Argent calls upon girlfriend Lydia Bright to help him throw a dinner party for four strangers at his Essex home. Brian McFadden hosts the game show where diners try to guess the identity of a mystery host holding a dinner party in order to win a cash prize

programme.title: Paddington Station 24/7
programme.desc: Mobile operations manager Jane is called to Burnham, Buckinghamshire, where a van has struck a bridge, and it is up to her to assess whether any significant damage has been caused to the railway line that runs over it. When a train breaks down on platform 15 of Reading station, staff are under pressure to identify and rectify the issue as quickly as possible to avoid any widespread delays, but fixing a fault with the brakes proves to be very complex

programme.title: Heathrow: Britains Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes of the airport, finding out how its infrastructure helps staff process thousands of passengers arriving from 84 countries. Narrated by Joanna Lumley

programme.title: Britains Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host as more performers take to the stage to try to impress judges Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon, Bruno Tonioli and guest judge KSI, and secure their place in the live semi-finals

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Storage Hoarders
programme.desc: Aggie MacKenzie meets Robbie, who hopes to get his hands on a family fortune by helping his mother get rid of her overwhelming stash of possessions. She also tries to make Vicky see past the sentimentality she has for her huge book collection

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: TV, radio and stage performer Debbie McGee puts on a dinner party for four strangers, who have to work out the identity of their mystery celebrity host with the help of a few cryptic clues - otherwise they will be doing the washing up. Hosted by Brian McFadden

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants Danika, Tim, Steven and Abi vie to find the single unbeatable answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a family themed edition of the game show. programme.desc: Frances Atkins puts four amateurs through a series of culinary tests, including how to make the perfect salad dressing, with the aim of choosing one to join her in the final

programme.title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul meets a hyperactive staffie called Cookie, who training staff believe could make an excellent working dog, but this is not usual for staffies, so finding someone to take him on may be difficult. Paul also meets a two-year-old Dogue de Bordeaux in need of some love after being found abandoned in a park, and nine-month-old teacup poodle Charlie is having trouble running with her broken leg. Head vet Shaun explains that Charlie has three breaks on one leg, and the best thing for her is going to be to remove it

programme.title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul OGrady helps to train a Pomeranian puppy called Stormy who arrived in Battersea at only nine weeks old. Elsewhere, Paul meets a French bulldog in desperate need of an operation to open his airways, and there is also an arrival of 20 dogs who turn up unexpectedly in need of temporary accommodation

programme.title: Love Island Games
programme.desc: In Fiji, fan-favourite Islanders from all over the globe compete once again for the winning accolade and grand prize of $100,000 - and perhaps a second chance at love. Hosted by Ariana Madix and narrated by Iain Stirling

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host interviews award-winning actor Martin Freeman, star of The Last of Us Bella Ramsey, and musician Jarvis Cocker before a special musical performance by Britpop figureheads, Pulp

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Hollywood star Nicole Kidman talks about in new Sky drama The Undoing, pop queen Kylie Minogue chats and performs her current single Magic, while comedian Jason Manford shares some amusing anecdotes. Also on the guest list are British boxing champion-turned-Strictly contestant Nicola Adams and actors Josh OConnor and Emma Corrin, who are playing the roles of Charles and Diana in the new season of The Crown

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills
programme.desc: Erika lands in hot water with Garcelle over some choice words, Kyle tries to atone for some words of her own and Lisa is amused by Dianas new look
